e0zX_ISBdCihrgdmoSaLXA.text: The food at this place was good. The reason I'm giving the 5 stars is for the service. When we walked in the host was very friendly. Our server, Kevin was absolutely amazing. He was so friendly, attentive, and just on it. I have to say this guy would be a great server in a 5 star restaurant, he was so pleasant. It is so hard to find such a great server these days. I am so impressed, because rarely do I get this great of service. Thank you Kevin, I will definitely be back and request Kevin.  We had another amazing dinner at CPK in Town Square. The food was good, but once again our service was great. Jasx or Jasmine she said she goes by either name was on point, super friendly, and just on it when it came to service. She will make your dinner more enjoyable, because she is so nice. Thank you.

JYEGhuicWQN9cUwTHwiWwg.text: This is the place for a variety of pizza plus choices of salads, soups, appetizers, drinks, and dessert all while in a very family friendly environment. I feel this place is big enough to serve large families, but there are also more secluded places for a quiet meal.  There is the bar where all the action happens- tv and the oven can be your entertainment. Yes, CPK is a chain, but a great place at TS to stop in and know your children in the stroller are welcome and also it won't break the bank.  Service has always been eager and friendly to help you have a positive dining experience.  Don't forget they have to to go option as well.  I have yet to eat out on the patio,but that may be the place for a more quiet meal.  They do have some lighter menu items for the health conscious which is always good.  Food has been consistent the handful of times that I have eaten here. It tastes how the menu describes it and how the picture looks.  So next time you are hungry after shopping or need to kill some time before the movie- stop by CPK.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria, arugula and asparagus salad, and complimentary bread.

P8wNgGTSB5HB8QcTl825qg.text: After some exhaustive shopping, Mom, sister and I decided CPK sounded good and with the weather in Vegas being so fabulous (it's that 2 week window between being hot as an over and cold as a freezer), we decided we'd dine al fresco.  We were immediately seated and our wonderful server (who's name I regrettably didn't get) immediately took our drink and dinner order.  We started with a large Caesar salad to share and it was, well...ok. It wasn't like the CPK Caesar I remember. It just seemed lacking-the dressing was almost non-existent on parts of it. The croutons and Parmesan cheese were, however, delicious. On to the star of the show...the pizza. My mom and I ordered the roasted garlic chicken pizza. Onions, garlic, chicken, cheese...need I say more? I'm quite certain that our breath was kickin' afterward but it was worth it. So good. So, so, so good! My sister ordered the club pizza and she liked it but it wasn't that great as a leftover-mainly due to the avocados on it.  The service was top notch, the pizza was on point and all in all, you just can't go wrong with CPK!

VhDn-sFLh_mi-eCN4jUN6g.text: Its a chain, so food is consistent. Service was great....but the food is just ok for me. I usually avoid CPK, but went here for a birthday, and had fun. This time the food was good, our waiter was super nice and we had a great time. Because of this I gave this CPK a higher rating then normal.

50OVN_u3XFWfnR7j983YIg.text: I got the artichoke and spinach pizza and it was super delicious. Jasmine was the best server. She was very attentive and was right there when we needed or brought us drinks before we even had to ask. She made our night.

Y7KOnyniM2M3eO7Z_98RNQ.text: Always a good meal.   Service was excellent.   Wait, even on Valentine's Day, was non existent. We were seated right away. And it was busy.   Two thumbs up!

Rd5YaXmtDoJt3dQFVR-s5w.text: This place was very good and had some really great menu options.  It definitely is worth going to !!!

oZ_bFQy72zjl61bSCzFV4A.text: After trick or treating thru town square we decided to stop in. Dinner was great, service was on point and our server found us a $10 off coupon, score ! Thanks CPK for great service.

QtM7SGSVbXDgD-ir17WTlg.text: The food is good, service is usually pretty fast, the drinks are a little pricey, $5 for a bud light and $10 for a Moscow Muel.

jdPzU2SZXO251XgRRm3ziw.text: My team and I had a luncheon here on a day when California Pizza Kitchens (CPKs) had a special promotion to benefit a local charity (check out those Yelp event listings!)  So, I didn't feel as guilty indulging in a carb fest, knowing that we were giving back to our community.   PIZZAS The Original BBQ Chicken (original hand tossed): I'm confident that I can eat this single-handedly. BBQ chicken + GOUDA CHEESE on pizza as a perfect combo and completely threw me off. It has just the right amount of sweet and savory flavors.  Wild Mushroom (original hand tossed): I love mushrooms on my pizza, but this was practically bland. We didn't order the white truffle oil, which might've added that missing flavor factor. I'm not saying the pizza wasn't good, but it didn't stand out among the others.   Margherita (thin crust): Simple and delicious. I loved the cheesy, stringy Mozzarella, but I wasn't a fan of the crust. Despite that, the pie was a hit.   DESSERT Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake: Warm, rich and fudgy, and it's served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!   SERVICE Great. Make reservations ahead of time. The place was busy during lunch, but our server and her team went above and beyond with taking care of my table's needs. Shout out to Jesse, the GM, who also did an awesome job ensuring that we were enjoying our experience.  OVERALL I may have to return in the future to try some of their more interesting pizza creations.

5Tx-dAH_xGkFbk6ebND9cA.text: We picked up take-out from here and I ordered the spaghetti bolognese. When my husband brought it home I was disappointed to see that although the noodle portion was generous there was little to no "bolognese sauce" on top. What constituted as their sauce was tidbits of chopped tomato, bits of minced beef and a sprinkle of parsley. Definitely worth the price and it bared no resemblance  to the picture on the website. Very disappointing.

bshSIRp0pXIBeAQDCVX0zA.text: Rich is a great worker. He was serving us and did an excellent job. Very happy with his service.

AcLLyCyEuGnpscdyCDo5Hw.text: Pros: The food is very delicious. My wife and I tried "dynamite shrimp" and "BBQ chicken pizza". Both were great especially the shrimp which was served with a sweet and yummy sauce. nice place next to the casino and all craziness.   Cons: The waiting time was relatively long. The food price is expensive; 7" pizza starts from ~$20 and starter from ~$12.

mLyQ5KXpbzZ3PqwGT1GFgg.text: What's not to love about CPK! A tried and True pizza joint. When I lived in California, I ate at CPK a lot for lunch. So, when I found a CPK out here in Vegas, I just had to go back for more. This location is large with a lot of seating, but there is always a wait to get in on the weekends. The wait is usually about 15-20 mins. This location is conviently located in town square so there is plenty to do while you wait or after dinner.

LlFmVh0ME0yPItUyMBxsQA.text: I have a lunch date with my mother every Saturday afternoon and we decided on CPK so we could do some shopping at TS after lunch last Saturday.. I hadn't been to CPK in forever and the only location I've ever been to is the one at Fashion Show. We arrived at 3:30 and surprisingly the place was full and there was a 15 minute wait.    This place reminded me of Chuckie Cheese with all the kids everywhere. LOL I much prefer the atmosphere at the Fashion Show location. Everything here just seemed kind of cheap even the napkins... & I swear I remember the food tasting much better.  -Mango Sangria: Reminded me of Mexican candy which I happen to like haha but there were only 3 pieces of fruit in there and I couldn't even taste any wine/alcohol..  -Grilled Peaches & Shrimp Salad: Loved this salad!!! Tangy dressing and fresh field greens.. Shrimp were small though.  -Wild mushroom Pizza with chicken: This used to me my favorite pizza. I feel like there used to be more mushrooms with stronger flavors. The crust used to be perfect and kind of sweet. -Jambalaya Pasta: It was too spicy/peppery for me. I prefer Cheesecake Factory's version..  -Complimentary bread: Wasn't even warm & the butter was ice cold.    Service was friendly. I just think with so many other options at TS.. California Pizza Kitchen doesn't stand out. & if I really wanted their pizza I could get it in the frozen aisle at the grocery store.   HOT TIP: Go on their website for a $5 off coupon~!!!

Considering that it was our fault for placing a pick up at the wrong location, they took care of everything. Awesome customer service !

RNzqcCM0PBFmZv0FbQILSw.text: Miguel was a great waiter - very attentive and prompt.  All the food was great and had vegetarian choices.  We thoroughly enjoyed it and the jumbalya.  Everyone in our party left full and satisfied with their food choices.

mak1Q13_bUrTD2ng-XMI1g.text: I have been a CPK fan for years!! Today's lunch came short of all my expectations. I could complain about everything that was wrong about my lunch, but I'd rather just talk about the worst part of my lunch. Whatever I ate made me so nauseous and sick to my stomach. If throwing up weren't so painful I would force it out of me.

t1DWxeC3O9Ae5yWKC5cMag.text: An absolutely terrible experience!  We are locals and will not be back!!!  The management team running the house today should be food runners at best, not managers!  I watched as the host staff sit several six top tables with two people while large groups sat waiting.  Then sat two tops with parties of two, who arrive much after the larger parties.  If you can not manage your house, you are not a "manager".  Quit running food and manage your restaurant. kFctRLqrkTSkzIp_F9ccEQ.text: Ok pizza, I like the thin crust but they dont put much for toppings, have to ask for extra cheese and pepperoni to make it like a real pizza place.

EpzjugeqXs4d_f-pzj853A.text: I've been a CPK fan ever since they were a small pizza franchise in the early days. CPK serves quality pizza and pastas with fresh ingredients, and good service. And now, despite growing in size and location, CPK has stayed mostly True to it's roots, keeping their food quality unchanged and the service above and beyond the norm. This is the first time me and the wife has tried CPK at this busy location (Town Square), one because it was always crowded, and two because being a tourist-centric location we feared it might take a toll on the quality of the food and service. We were delightfully proven wrong however, our server was friendly, attentive and prompt, our meal (Wild Mushroom Pizza and Chicken Piccata) arrived in a timely manner and tasted just how it was -- very good. We left fairly satisfied and happy knowing that CPK has achieved what most restaurant food chains have failed in growth: maintaining what you loved about them at the beginning.

Hnw8c22iTGg15RVz6Cb27w.text: Our go to dinner spot when me & my bf are at town square. They always have great service and are pretty quick. Great if you have kids or a lunch date.

TeLhvVm1s_HCHA5WeEKyYA.text: I love their Caesar salad with salmon pieces added. I also like the artichoke dip with pita bread or the chips and the Jamaican jerk pizza.  My kids love the pizza. I also have had the butter cake with ice cream. It sounds nasty but after I had a piece of my friends I have to eat that in special occasions cause I trying to stay fit. Lol.

sFi8jGhLYgWwz7MBR52_6Q.text: Worst service ever! Beware of this waitress from hell, Rebecca (Becky), who not only was rude, discourteous and incompetent, but was also a complete and utter disgrace to the service industry. The manager, Richard Bickerton, did not do anything to prevent this waitress from further insulting us and ruining our dinner.  We've been longtime patrons of CPK but never encountered a waitress who deliberately went out of her way to annoy an irritate us with her poor service and unprofessional demeanor.  She should have just stayed home as she was obviously having a bad day instead of taking out her misplaced anger on longtime CPK customers like us.  Shame on CPK for hiring servers like her!

GKmXhE-BdBEZR20EhAgI9A.text: We have been going up CPK for years when residing in California. This is the first experience here in Las Vegas. And it ended on a very negative note. Food was acceptable. Service acceptable. When we paid for the dinner, our credit card was "lost"!!! They searched for 1/2 hour and never found it. I left my name phone number and address with the manager and specifically asked for an update if they found it. Never happened. I canceled my card. Next day I called to see if they found it and magically they found it in the check cover with the bill. But they hadn't gotten around to calling and may never have had I not called them first. I'm very disappointed on the follow through and more at having to cancel my card wait for a new one and then not be informed of the originals finding. They have not earned my return especially the poor handling of the card and the complete lack of follow up. The manager needs to do immediate retraining and when things like this happen, have in place mechanisms that fix the problem, customer, and affix responsibility for follow through!!

BFpJ51ZObFr-DvWGkwFDXw.text: I always wondered what CPK was like in person instead of the microwaved pizzas they offer in grocery stores lol. Great environment in this location at Town Square. Waitresses were friendly and so was the hostess. We were seated very fast. The place is big but cluttered. Not enough room to make it to the bathroom without squeezing by tables and interrupting others dinner or running into a waiter. Great selection of food from the appetizers to the main dishes and desserts. I had a great time and food experience and will definitely visit CPK more often.

cXMNWq8rJWzWZljQNIHheA.text: Completely forgot how much I love this place!  They have amazing thin crust pizza...you won't be disappointed.  And yes the salads are great too.  We had the thin crust pepperoni, the chop salad and an appetizer (I can't remember which one!?) to share and it was perfect!  A bonus to this location is being able to walk around Town Square afterwards :)

X-porXmS0pT3PIIzmSVZBA.text: Great service and friendly atmosphere. The California Club Pizza is a must pick along with the California Club Sandwich but don't order it with the new Mediterranean Bread they have. Overall great experience and I'd definitely stop back in for a quick bite.

TRGM46Z4-tc56hdjkyK_xA.text: For me the pizza is too expensive and and the flavors too exotic. For example, I tried the Pear & Gorgonzola pizza. It isn't bad, but I'm in no hurry to go back and order another. If you're in the area, I'd recommend going to Claim Jumpers instead.

k6zqUsC_CpnGHYpPVnyXVg.text: The worst service I've ever had at this CPK. My waitress was Tracy and I've got to say she's one of the worst servers I've seen. When we asked for bread, she only gave us 3 pieces and we were four people while we saw a group of 2 get 5-6 pieces of breads. While we had our food she didn't come to see how the food was. While we were eating she just dropped down the bill  like she wanted us out in a hurry. My mother was eating her Cobb salad and the bacon was cold and raw. My father ordered a vegetarian pizza and asked for goat cheese and when the pizza came it had no goat cheese and on the bill they charged us extra for goat cheese. The pizza I ordered was a barbecue chicken and it was good. But like I said she rushed us out. When we were eating she came up to us and asked us for dessert. While my family was of course still eating. She deserved no tip at all. I would recommend while in Las Vegas. Don't go this California pizza kitchen. I'd  recommend the ones at downtown summerlin, which has excellent service and the fashion mall had a good one. But finally I've got to say WOW! A fast food place can do better than you guys.

7jiAFzzT5WN6VrhgIw4plg.text: Service here is usually great.  But i donno the food doesnt really sell me on anything super duper spectacular.  It's a nice place to hit if you have pizza fans with you at town square.  But personally i'd rather go down the street to claim jumper or yardhouse.

eUB6-KAwa7tqM_erOjw4hw.text: I was in Town Square last month and decided to try this place while I was out with family.  It's a pretty big restaurant with a welcoming environment.  The host was very nice.. and we only had to wait about 8 minutes to be seated.  This place is pretty busy and I soon found out why.  They have comfortable booths with outside seating as well.  I had the Thai Chicken pizza (1st visit) and the Four Seasons Vegetarian pizza (2nd visit).  The portion was generous and if I remember correctly I paid $12.  The waiters and waitresses where very courteous and they made sure we were tooken care of.  A few weeks ago I noticed that they also have frozen pizza in the frozen food section at stores.  I bought a couple for me and my daughter and they were "almost" as good as the actual restaurant but still very good.  CPK is a great restaurant with great staff.

gBze8RyISlHiAYZ106byhg.text: I've been to CPK a few times and I really don't think there's anything that great about it.  My wife likes it so we go but I'm never very excited about their pizzas or food.  I think it is a little pricey for what you are getting.  I can eat one of their pizzas by myself and still be hungry and then I'm out $12.  On the flip side, there really isn't anything wrong with it.  The service is always fine and their food tastes good.  I would just rather go somewhere like Settebello but when you have a pregant wife, what are you gonna do?

PPveOQrvaIq1qTJh6OwYCQ.text: Had a gift card and finally got down to Town Center to use it. Ordered garlic parm chicken pizza and a spinach artichoke dip with white pita bread. Bill came to 27 dollars and change. They told me to the food would be ready at 5, I had ordered around 4:45 pm. I got there at 5:10 because I parked in the wrong lot. The pizza was in the oven ready. I couldnt believe it when he pulled it out. It was a bar pie - I was expecting something a bit larger. He brought the spinach dip over and put both in a bag and said I had to wait on the bread. A full ten minuted later he brought the bread over - he should have at least left the pizza in the pizza warmer  while I wait, at least it would have been warm when I got home. The pizza was nothing special - it was ok , the spinach dip was excellent and the pita (the only thing that actually was still warm when I got home) was good as well. I didn't like the price, I expected leftovers for $27 I made quick work of the pizza ,dip and bread and was still a little hungry.

UtD_aLTrLWEPL9cLd_FF7g.text: Great place to eat! Food is quick and friendly staff. Only had one bad experience here but they ended up comp.ing our meals and gave us two free entrees with drinks for later.

_vU7VCBzJ1zn_aaLF39cvA.text: Generic CPK. Love the white pizza. This location is always packed and a little slow on service. If they can just get that kicked up a notch, I would probably frequent them more often. They also train their servers to do a huge pet peeve of mine. They ask young children in my group what they want to drink directly, even suggesting things like chocolate milk. I hate that. I will make those decisions and I don't need them instigating it.

RepAPYvA77LifIznt9P_WQ.text: Ate the white pizza and it was not bad.   I can't say it's better than Grimaldi's.

rFzaUMi_i7M5MN5YYB8UaQ.text: CPK is one of my favorite restaurants at Town Square, and I do prefer this location among all. I have tried almost every pizza they have, but my absolute favorite has to be chicken chipotle, it's the best, I usually don't like most of its ingredients, but I do like it on this pizza for sure, a little spicy but definitely tasty. Their salads are good too, soups are worth mentioning as well, and lastly the dessert is rich. Overall great servers and hosts. Amazing restaurant.

P9Ww8WunzYb51GRh7-ISqg.text: This California Pizza Kitchen, located in the newest shopping center on Las Vegas Blvd S, Towne Center. The service was quick and efficient, the waiter was attentive. The only problems I had with this location was, that my meal felt rushed because the waiter was not only attentive but it seemed like he was trained to "turnover" his tables quickly. I had the Barbeque Chicken Pizza which was good, but they were light on the barbeque sauce. Also I had a Raspberry Mojito that was very watery, and my dessert was just average. Overall, this restaurant has potential if they just slow down.

He has 4 tables that he's taking care of and it's not even busy. If I ever come back here I'll remember not to have him as a server. Date of serve was 8/20/18. Our waitress did her job but she wasn't really enthusiastic.  She just did enough.  The last time, the waitress went out of her way to make me feel at hole and topped off our drinks without being asked.  Overall this time it was just average.

qzc0EuIOKXX0qEaOGed9HA.text: The food was great but the service was even better. My man RICH was very kind and generous. You can tell he really cared and was putting his best foot forward while working. Good stuff rich :)

OgfyG0xg_rNwJVxwKq5QVw.text: Is it just me or this place is a little too dark? I get the whole "intimate setting" thing but I couldn't help but think about it being too dark in there. Maybe I'm going crazy!    We were seated immediately, drinks came right away, the server took our orders as soon as we were ready, food came 10-15 mins later.   Many food selections, but I chose the basic Fettuccini Alfredo. Pasta was good, sauce was creamy. My friend ordered a chicken dish with mixed veggies. Though I didn't get to try it, their expressions seemed like they weren't disappointed.   I remember coming here every time I was at TS back when I was in HS. I felt like they had better selections then compared to now.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccini Alfredo.

IBPjbw2kbASrvH1Lc1qHSw.text: Came here on a Tuesday night around 7/8. There were a couple of parties ahead of us. It was a 10-15 minute wait. I was honestly surprised that there was even a wait since it was a weekday.   Anyway, we were seated at a table that I felt like was way too big for 3 people. Lol there are plenty of good choices on the menu! I was stuck because I really wanted to order something fatty... but I knew I couldn't *insert crying emoji*. I settled for the chicken & veggies - sorry, I don't remember the exact name of the dish. My bf ordered the same thing & my friend had the pasta. We were given bread before our food came; it was hot & delicious! I like that they put herbs and I think chili flakes in the oil. The food came out maybe 15-20 mins later. The chicken & veggies were sooooo good. I was honestly surprised because I thought it would be bland. The portion was pretty big so I took half for my lunch the next day!   The service was okay, no complaints. She always made sure that our waters were filled but didn't really talk or ask questions much. Will definitely come back!

noCem7ixBdKyV0911LoaIA.text: I took my kids for Fathers Day lunch at this location. The 4 years old baby had a kids cheese and tomato pizza ,my teenager daughter had some chicken with pasta and I had a salad with extra chicken breast . The kids have shared bites from each other's plates.  8-10 hours after the lunch both of kids can't stop throwing up. As a dad I can't express how I feel about this. From my intentions to provide them a nice lunch with their dad we end up into 24hours of pain and suffering for them. It's sad and sickening that this concept still stays in bussines.  Shame on you California Pizza Kitchen,I really hope you will close doors soon.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This two meals have turned a father day lunch into a horrible painful day. Both kids ended up with food poisoning.

GztkD26BmDTiq2hjgxN2OA.text: I've been to this location twice now and the first time I was unimpressed by the service. I wanted a sample of their new sangrias because they looked delicious (but i'm super picky) and was told that its made to order which is new to me because I know that they always premake batches of it early in the day or whenever they run out. Anyway, during the first visit, our server didn't check back with us after we received our food, nor did he offer any water refills.   However, I came back today because it was a birthday celebration. Service tonight was great! Our server was attentive and waters were refilled without us asking. Food is amazing as always.   3/5  wild mushroom strozzapreti- I wasn't a huge fan of the pasta, it was on the harder side so if I were to order this dish again, I would probably sub penne or fusilli for it. I don't believe there was a sauce to it... maybe just olive oil or something but I did enjoy the variety of mushrooms (not that I could tell the different mushrooms apart). My friend said the dish was kind of on the bitter side, but I only had two bites and couldn't really tell nor mind it.   4/5 Kung pao spaghetti with chicken-  despite all the dried red chili peppers, its not spicy! Spaghetti noodles were cooked perfectly, however it was on the salty side and lacked some peanuts. I gave two of my gfs a bite and they loved it.   5/5 Bbq chicken salad with avocado- I've tried lazy dog's, BJs and a few other restaurants' bbq chopped salad and they don't seem to compare to CPK's. The full sized salad made for a good appetizer for the table (party of 6)  before our entrees came out. I was glad that it wasn't drenched in dressing unlike previous visits.   While I didn't try the halibut, two of my gfs ordered it and said it was kind of dry. They did enjoy the farro and said that the halibut was a nice size.

Ns8Qaa_sbnv9cXHYvLQZ9A.text: love. love. love.  I had a stressful interview on the strip and wanted to get some lunch, so I stopped at a place I know in Town Center- CPK. I sat at the bar, and had the greatest server. He needed a shoutout.  I asked him for suggestions on the menu, he had options for me, and suggested two salads, and something that caught my eye- the Spinach & Artichoke Pizza. We discussed in length the difference between that pizza and the classic BBQ Chicken. Well, His suggestions were great, didn't try to oversell me and cracked me up the entire time I was there.   The manager was near the bar area and was extremely involved in the kitchen as well as his serving staff, which was really nice to see.   I have been there twice while in Vegas, and while I love small local business, this is a place I will frequent.

nzJFDUrIvBo3o9ReXTe72w.text: I have never really had a bad experience at any CPK location.  This place didn't disappoint.  Only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because there is always a wait here.  But it's in a busy area so I accept it.  I just wish it didn't have a wait.   The prices are the same and food is consistent.  I love there salads and appetizers here.  This is a great place for you and your friends to come in have a few drinks and appetizers then go shopping around at Town Square.  Great family atmosphere.   The staff is really nice and always polite. One time the staff gave me a free velvet cake because of the wait.  Didn't expect that and it was a pleasant surprise.

YZFXumxIPgXW_TyUCkWF3A.text: First time and experience was great.  We told our waiter it was our first time and asked for recommendations, although he was a bit vague, we truly appreciated that he brought over a Complimentary appetizer item for us to try. He brought us a flatbread (cannot remember exactly which one..sorry) I thought it was a very nice gesture. Things like that don't happen much these days.  It as ok..a bit salty.  We ended up ordering the bbq chicken pizza, tequila chicken pasta and for appetizers the guacamole and blue corn dip with Chips.  I have to say I wasn't  really impressed.  Our pasta was hard and dip a little too sweet.  Pizza was ok, but nothing made me feel like It's someplace I'd purposely choose to go to again.  Waiter gets 5 stars

bZjhzSk9gkT7nuwf9iWVug.text: Such a great place to stop by for lunch.  We had a great time today, but I feel the need to warn you guys - don't order the Mahi Mahi Tacos! Blech!  You get two rubbery, fishy rectangular prism fish stick things inside a flavorless tortilla.  No beuno!  But then again, it's not the California Taco Kitchen, so I should have known better :) Everything else was awesome as usual.

0Syo6Qft9QrDORVL-xleCQ.text: The pizzas are delicious I usually order for pick up I have noticed that you're ordering  at a different location and it gets transferred to the restaurant the computers are constantly freezing as you're trying to order and it takes a while for them to transfer your order to the restaurant so when they tell me my order is going to be ready at a certain time it takes about 20 minutes after that time . We saw a table get seated approximately 10 minutes after us and they were waited on immediately. We still had menus on our table to indicate that we have yet to place our order and still no one would come by and wait on us.  Finally after 20 minutes we decided to leave, We walked past the same hostesses that seated us 20 minutes earlier and she automatically said their automatic goodbye "thank you have a good day"  we then advised them that we are leaving because we never got waited on to which they responded "okay have a good day" we then asked "did you hear what we just said... we said, we are LEAVING because no one took our order" she then asked what table number were you at? we just left after the fact that no one helped us and her only response was which table number are you at.  if you want to sit in peace and quiet and smell pizza then is the place for you however if you are looking for a place to eat then i suggest you try another restaurant in town square

7tezZodI-twLoKqYuu-L3A.text: Tonights (Veteran's Day) trip to CPK was very good. Although it was very loud, the food that hit the table was excellent. 60jNqZi5dzCIs8Zho1x00A.text: Been here a few times. The second visit was this afternoon.  It wasn't busy at all but we were sat down and greeted by a friendly waiter who stated our waitress was Melissa and she would be with us shortly. The first gentleman took our drink order and returned immediately with our drinks and some bread for snacking. We waited approximately 30 minutes and watched our waitress serve another table their food and greet another table but never having  approached  us. Finally we decided we had waited long enough  and began to walk out finally our waitress  came up and asked where we were leaving too. Needless to say I will not be back again. 2W4sVTT7NbT7LKZn3F67xA.text: Went here right before they closed with some family. The restaurant looked really nice and our server Kevin was a sweetheart. We ordered the hummus to start and then we ordered a Sicilian pizza, Hawaiian pizza and the five cheese pizza. My favorite was definitely the Sicilian. If I'm craving some yummy thin crust pizza, I'll be back!

fU-1AP6IEyN_czxFVFmSvA.text: I used to work for this company for many many years. One thing that never changes is my love for the food that is made here. Avocado eggrolls, baja/Thai rolls, spin dip with pita as the best apps ever, not just from here but any chain. You can't beat the flavor and quality of those ones. Yes, this is a pizza place. But we come here for the salads. Great portions for a great price. If you haven't had the roasted veggie salad with grilled chicken you are not living life! Also the Thai crunch salad is probably one of the best salads out there, you need avocado on this one to fully bring it to realization but you'll really enjoy it if you're into peanuts. Many other places make Amazon BBQ chicken salads, but this is the place that gave everyone the opportunity to sell them. Get the salad if you're into originals. The Sicilian pizza with extra sauce and Serrano peppers until death and the chicken and shrimp marinara pasta will forever be my one love (unless the broccoli fusilli comes back) CPK is a part of my soul. I love this restaurant.The food here will forever take me to a time frame of my life that I truly valued and enjoyed for this is my favorite place to eat. Ever.

If you are down in or around the strip area, enjoy pizza, pasta, etc.  This is your place.    Have the most awesome incredible dessert too.   Enjoyed very much!!

h_9GaDyrt6C7SzVyVpqUjg.text: it should be a 2.5, not a 3 star.  Great location, clean, friendly.  it was a Sat afternoon, not too busy. Water glass went empty, took a long time for food. when food arrived soups were hot, pasta was warm and the flatbread pizza was barely warm. Overall:  Nice location; very clean; friendly; food presentation good, food was okay (pesto pasta was good); service just okay.  I will not go back, there are many other choices. UmlIBYfm609LRqHPgIVQpA.text: Normally. I have good experiences at California Pizza Kitchen, but the service experienced on 10/1 at this location was horrendous. Apparently, we had just missed a big rush since it was homecoming weekend for one of the high schools. We got there as the rush ended, and we're seated within 10 minutes.  Our server started out friendly and talkative at first. But as time progressed, the service went downhill. It took at least 15 min for us to get our appetizer, and then about 45 minutes to get our pizza. Not only that,  but the server never apologized for how long it was taking for our food to come out. I noticed another table of 5 (compared to our 2) had ordered the same appetizer, and received it quicker than we did. Hummus shouldn't take 15 minutes. Also, once we got the pizza,  the server made sure that it was not made with wheat since that's what I'm allergic to...however....I found it very odd that he said he made our pizza himself. Once we were ready for our check,  the process took another 10 to 15 minutes since we didn't know where our server was, and we had to ask someone else if we could have our check. Our server seemed to be in lala land. I used to be a server myself, and had the service been 20% better, the server probably would have received a better tip, and not $2, and I wouldn't be taking my business elsewhere due to the lack of customer service at this restaurant. I gave this place 2 stars because while the service was horrendous, the food was still good. But I probably won't be back here based on the service received.

1ml_5ZGW_VX8tb6LMIvD_Q.text: The hosts and hostess (I only got her name, Nicole!) were too busy in their own conversations that they forgot that we waited 45 minutes before realizing they were calling people that came after us. What makes it even worse is when I confronted her about it, she had the audacity to claim we never went up to her and we sat right by them, literally the bench closest to them! This is a prime example of one of my pet peeves when eating out. Be more attentive and do your job!!! I have proof of the time we sat down with a picture if she reads this! The food didn't taste as awesome, either! Thanks for ruining my Friday night!

0-nH-2_9hsOhqfJ2A1TrGg.text: I recently visited this CPK location on a Saturday night. We got there around 5pm with a party of 4 plus a high chair. We were told that the wait would be about 15 mins.   When about 15 minutes passed we were called. The Host tried to seat us at a table meant for 4. As we realized that it would be pretty tight, I noticed a number of tables which were empty. It amounted to a whole section which was closed as they ran a wait list. We asked for another table with more room and we were directed to wait again.   When we got our new table about 10 minutes after that we noticed that the section was still closed.   For an appetizer we ordered the white corn guacamole and chips. For dinner, we ordered the California Veggie Pizza and a Roasted Veggie Salad.   The guacamole came out right away. The portion was rather small and in my opinion lacked flavor. We added salt to it.   Dinner took a while to come out, in my opinion, longer than it should have. When it did we again found that the California Veggie Pizza lacked flavor and needed salt. I will say that the Roasted Veggie Salad was good.   With so many other restaurants in Town Square to chose from, CPK needs to step up their game.

GW4DFWFWAvOkuWemOYWKhQ.text: Jaime the manager was great to send a complimentary appetizer when our cousins stood us up. Our server Jacky was attentive and the Jambalaya is perfect!!!

wOA-Ay4hNTAHx0F1ONV2IQ.text: The food is good, the environment is great, and the location is ideal. However, the best part about this particular California Pizza Kitchen is the server Rich. Rich is energetic and a pleasure to be around. He's always checking on your table, refilling drinks without being asked, and extremely cheerful. Rich makes the CPK experience a delight.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9d_EiuS3rgDLJZoPP7QyjA.text: Delicious pizza, excellent customer service. Their bartender recommended wine to go with my carne asada pizza and it was a great pair. I got the chocolate souffle cake for dessert and didn't care for it much, it was pretty bitter chocolate cake. I would recommend the butter cake, however. We elected to sit outside with our two kids and were a little worried when we sat down about being forgotten about since it seems pretty secluded on their patio but our waitress was very attentive and friendly. We were never left to sit there wondering when someone would come check on us. The only complaint is that since TownSquare is right next to the airport, we were sitting right underneath the flight path and it was very loud every 3-5 minutes or so when the planes would fly over, and though that is obviously not CPK's fault, it did interfere with our experience a bit. Still, I would recommend this restaurant for couples, families, colleagues, and even going alone. Very pleasant atmosphere.

vznTHPkIzwhkY3Xd_Xzcmg.text: My kids love CPK and when we are at Town Square, that's usually what they ask for.  This time around 5:30 our wait was less than 5 minutes, usually it's around 30. After being seated our waiter arrived, took drinks orders and when he returned, promptly took our food orders. Approximately, 10-15 minutes later our food arrived.  My youngest older a BBQ chicken pizza which she  loves. Older daughter ordered a margarita pizza, I shared it with her along with a chicken Caesar salad. Service and quality has always been consistent in my opinion, and I'm sure we'll return again.

QQrHPz8QPaoa90GlGN5MEg.text: This is my first time going to California Pizza Kitchen. Our server was nice and gave us a complimentary bianco bread( oily cheese bread)- which I can't have because I can't dairy. So I stared at it lol. I ate the bread though. I ordered the, SMASHED CHICKEN MEATBALL PIADINA - Housemade chicken meatballs, crushed tomato sauce with wilted baby kale, fresh herb gremolata and Parmesan mustard aioli.   It's a Saturday and I ordered off the lunch menu- back page. It says on the menu the full sandwiches you can order all day every day. The waiter told me I wasn't supposed to order it because it was Saturday. How about you create 2 menus if you don't want people to order from that side? even though it said I could. He said he'd make it happen. So 45 minutes late we get our food( my bf ordered soup only). If I knew they were going to take that long I wouldn't have ordered it. We were running in for a quick bite. We were in a rush to leave so once we got our food we asked for the check and to go boxes. I received my food and realized it was $15( which I wasn't told ahead of time) for just the meatball thing, no sides... Who doesn't want a side? I opened it up and realized it was a cheese pizza folded with some meatball pieces inside. I can't have cheese! WTF? well parmesan is okay but there was freaking mozzarella everywhere. I don't know if that's what it is supposed to be? Really pissed off and had to go. I honestly didn't have time to argue or anything so I took it to go. I still have yet to eat my "pizza" with a few meatballs, or should i call it flatbread with meatballs since I am now going to have to scrape off the whole thing...Don't mess with my food I get really angry lol. Honestly I won't go back cause I'm way too stubborn. Just really irritated  Update: heated it up and could only eat half cause the cheese was stuck. The meatballs had good flavor but way to greasy. I stopped eating after  a few bites and threw it away

OI_nwUtY3z6XClHDv113Sg.text: My reason for four stars is because of the service. Otherwise, their menu items are three stars.  I was in a rush because I only had about an hour and 20 something minutes to head to work. Starving and coming up a little late on a lunch with my friend, we requested our food to arrive ASAP because of our situation. Our server was extremely kind (I believe her name was Heidi? Wonderful lady!) and got our food out to us in a matter of minutes. Even with our indecision about what wine to taste, she was doing the best she could to help us get in and out (even when her section was half full!) Our food had to have came out in a matter of 10-15 at most after we ordered, because we devoured it and still had time for me to head to work with a minute late to spare. My service experience was excellent, and I recommend if you're in a rush somewhere, don't be shy to tell them!  Otherwise, the food is three stars. This isn't saying its bad in the least, but then again there is nothing overly special about it either. The menus do hold a ton of variety when it comes to wines and pizza, so if you're in for a quick lunch, this would be the place in TS to stop by at!

qF6YSirPGo5iW4S5Feng5w.text: Really good food! I am surprised to hear about poor service as our server was friendly and our food came out SUPER fast!!!! We will definitely be back!!

sNMYfjUutViOckdKLrEu3w.text: Dear BBQ Chicken Salad,   I have had a major crush on you since about 1999. You are my favorite. I can't have anything but you whenever I dine at CPK. Seriously, I am like your secret stalker. They should probably put me in jail because I DESTROY YOU! Every last bite! You are probably the reason that some Salads get a bad rep, because there is nothing "diet-y" about you. Whatever you do, please don't change. Don't go and get all health conscious or go light on the dressing. Don't loose your tortilla strips or your delicious BBQ coated chicken. Just...be you. Forever. And always.   Love,   Katie S.   PS. This location is ok. Decent service, short wait on a peak night. Others at my table enjoyed their food. Consistent, fresh, fast.

vNTbyIPjlH_lc4iJLtVXZg.text: I love coming here but today decided to come for lunch and worst service we were sat right away but then no one came to check on us for about 15 min then a bus boy came to check on us and said "I'm not your waiter but ill get you drinks" we said who is then and he said "I dont kno,were trying to figure that out.  They cut a lot of people and that's why we are short handed. " he was great and ended up waiting on us the whole time. He needs a raise if it werent for him I would say I would never come back.  I dont blame him for bit checking on us since I'm sure this isn't his usual duties.

AsWf_MKx3Slizt8IPQuvBg.text: I just had lunch here with my friend and her new baby. We asked if we could sit somewhere where the stroller could be parked nearby and the hostess told us that strollers weren't allowed in the restaurant. So we took the car seat out if the stroller and they showed us to a booth. The booths were really cramped and the car seat wouldn't fit on the booth seat. This other hostess took the car seat out of my friends hands and basically wedged it between the table and the back of the booth. Ummmm... Not safe. We asked for a sling and they said the slings couldn't be set out because it would be a fire hazard. A few minutes later I looked behind me and there was a lady sitting at a table with her stroller parked next to her and on the other side of the restaurant was a woman with her car seat on a sling. Fail.  Update: I sent a note via their website asking how/why this happened.  A manager from the restaurant called me and apologized for the incident and sent me a gift certificate to use at any CPK restaurant.  I haven't received the gift certificate yet, but I appreciated the prompt apology and their effort to address what happened.

ym0fqdcF1dmrLnVFuRC-Yg.text: I like California Pizza Kitchen. It is a great go-to restaurant that is sure to please everyone.  The only reason why I gave this particular location 3/5 stars is because of the service. My sisters and I are regulars at the CPK in the Fashion Show Mall. The service there is always excellent. It's weird how we took  it for granted until we started frequenting the CPK at Town Square. The CPK at Town Square has inferior service. They lag on refilling drinks/water, are slow to greet, take your meal order, check on you, etc. Once, we've even gotten a straight up rude waitress. However, the service seems to be improving the last few times I've been. So there is hope!

CUHChuapgxJ5uW39NIF-2w.text: Dined here with my boyfriend for a late breakfast/early lunch while on this side of town running errands. The ambience inside the restaurant is really pleasant with lots of spacious windows filling the place with sunlight and the woodfire oven mirroring it with bright yellow tile. It's a very pretty space to dine in and the grand windows allow you ample people watching of all the hipsters ambling by.   The restaurant was packed while we were there, so service was a little slow. I had a cup of coffee that was a little stale, but the refill was much better. The coffee wasn't bitter and seemed like more of a light roast. I like that the cream comes in a small glass! Be aware that any of the espresso based drinks run about the same as Starbucks prices. They seemed to have a decent selection of beers but it was too early for me to dwell on them long.  We started with their minestrone soup, which was thick with different ingredients but wasn't mindblowingly amazing. I've had a richer depth of flavor in homemade versions, but it was a decent restaurant adaptation.   The salad we sampled had arugula, asparagus, parmesan, almonds and a few other simple toppings. It was a light starter on a long rectangular plate that made it easy to share between the two of us.   We had their vegetarian pizza with japanese eggplant and it was nice but fairly small. You would definitely need two pizzas if you were with a group of three or more very hungry people. Since we had shared a salad and a soup prior to having the pizza, it was a good amount of food to sustain us through "brunch"-time with two slices left over to provide a light meal for my boyfriend later in the day.   The pizza had a thin crust with a nice chewiness to it and the toppings were well chosen for the pizza but a little sparsely placed. There were large pieces of broccolini/broccoli rabe/baby broccoli that were hard for me to bite through and interrupted the otherwise lovely texture medley. I don't recall the eggplant standing out, which was a little disappointing but it may have just been covered in cheese.   Next time we venture over to this area there's a good chance we'll return to sample some of their other pizzas with some friends so we can have a better sampler of their offerings!

Ty-c6HcV6JDaNNqNS78zng.text: I'm not one to write reviews for larger chains mainly because if you've eaten at one it's very likely the other chain in the other part of town isnt much different.   Other reviews for this CPK are a tad old so now would be a great time for a refresher review.  Due to it's location at Towne Center the place is kinda packed with local shoppers and tourists alike, being crowded means being noisy, servers do tend to rush to get finished customers out and new customers in to keep the business moving. This is nothing new and should not count toward their overall score unless they stand there staring at you arms cross tapping their foot in a gesture that clearly says 'order desert or GTFO'  I completely agree with Ken O's observation that some of the menu items are a tad on the expensive side and are a bit too exotic. The chain seems to focus on a shot gun spread approach instead of specializing.   After over two years going to continue on Audrey W's review and report that the BBQ Chicken Pizza is still light on the sauce but still tasted pretty good.   Lettuce wraps were pretty awesome but they need to use fresher shrimp. The texture of the diced up frozen stuff they use is too mushy and it doesn't stand out among the other ingredients. Same goes with their water chestnuts as well, out of the entire entree i can only recall biting into something crisp that wasn't lettuce maybe three times.  Buddy got the standard 'oldie but goodie' pepperoni pizza. The pie was a bit greasy but a pepperoni pizza not having a noticeable layer of shine on top is like a zebra not having black and white stripes. One thing i did notice was the taste of the areas that didnt contain pepperoni. They were like black holes sucked away all the flavor and experience to leave you plain and unsatisfied.   From reading past almost year old reviews i can say the service has improved. There's a manager on the floor helping out the servers and ensuring quality control and getting feedback. Our own server was like a hawk...with video cameras...and a surveillance van commonly seen in police films and movies. If i were to give him a motto for the day it would have to be "leave no glass empty" seriously he swapped out our drinks when we had only a quarter left and during that time between debating if one should get the bill and call it or order a dessert and dread the gym the next day he still refilled our drinks. Homeboy hooked it up and earned himself a phat tip in the end.  Overall I can predict we'll be coming back here within the next three months.

AEjgwT1XufmWX0dVzML_pA.text: I have eaten at this place 3 times. The first time was great, the second was not good at all. We went back for a 3rd time because we wanted to give it one last chance. Unfortunately when we got there we were told there was no bread to be served, understandable on a busy Saturday night. However it's what took place after that really sealed the deal on whether or not we would return. The waitress brought me a Dr. Pepper that she later admitted she knew was watered down and after she dropped it off with our food, she didn't return for 15 minutes. So, I went my entire meal without a drink. When she returned, which only happened after I requested for the manager, she said she knew it was watered down but served it anyway instead of changing the soda in the back. She made us wait continuously throughout the night for refills, desert and even for our check. I don't complain often, but the icing on the cake was when she brought our check after us waiting for another 10 minutes for it she circled where the tip chart was on the bottom and she made it seem as if we wouldn't have tipped If she hadn't. This was all at 9 o'clock at night when there was maybe 3 tables in her area. The manager was helpful, but I'm not one to complain in store when I have to keep the waiter. The food was good, but such slow service I wouldn't likely return.

IuVnQ-zZPVahi5JkEs1CIg.text: Like it says, I've experienced better. I'm a fan of CPK.   I used to buy the CPK frozen pizzas until the topping disappeared.  So I stopped buy them and switched to Red Baron.  BTW. Very happy since I switched to Red Baron!!  Okay, back to CPK..  Now, I visit for the first time in over 8 years. I went to the location at Town Square. After a 40 minute wait, we were seated.  I didn't mind the wait since we bought an iMac from the Apple Store while waiting.  I also had enough time to shop at The Container Store.  Okay, maybe the wait was more than 40 minutes.   We were seated in a nice booth.  We had an opportunity to look at the menu and were greated by a waitress that was quiry to say the least. She had a quite intensity. I dare not upset her. I was extra nice to her and she seemed to respomd well to the nice gesture. When my buddy's gf wasn't paying much attention, the server became aggitated.  I felt then need to apologize for the gf's lack of attention.  Anyways, the meal was good.  The toppings were thick.   The only was that the server disappeared for long periods.  Our drinks ran empty three times and nobody was to be found. She also took a long time to bring and process the check.  The whole process from start to finish took two hours. We only ordered two pizzas and some drinks.  My friend did not like his Bloody Mary. I had strawberry tea, which was good.    Normally, I would be unhappy about the long wait and the even longer service, but at least I had already accomplished my shopping and we weren't late for the movie we came to see.  Maybe we saved money since the girls didn't have time to shop.  I wouldn't visit this CPK again.  Good food, bad everything else.  There are tons of great restaurants at the outlet mall down the street.

bfctnVEsIFPxuykR_O5Vbw.text: My boyfriend and I went to CPK last night for date night, they weren't really busy and they were under construction so some part of the restaurant was closed off, we were immediately greeted by the hostess which asked us if we wanted to sit at a booth or a table and we chose the table. She was very friendly, our server Tyler was amazing from the moment we sat down. He was constantly refilling our drinks, asking us if we needed anything and he was so nice! He told us to save some room for dessert but unfortunately we did not. The food was delicious, I wish I would've take it to go but we had a movie to see after. The place is upgrading and the customer service was phenomenal! I will be there again next week for our date night!

I expected the sauce to be more like white pasta sauce...but it was more like goat cheese, spinach and mozzerella (spelling probably wrong lol) cheese.  Other than that...the BBQ Chicken salad was AMAZING!

QtFEGSY8deZaWBLe6mTSRg.text: I've always been a fan, with my usual favorites. The pizza is good to share when I'm not super hungry. The lettuce wraps and sesame chicken dumplings (pot stickers) are great if you're after appetizers. When we've decided on our own entrees, my favorite is the kung pao spaghetti. It's a little bit stronger than I prefer but when they have a good cook in the kitchen I can get it tamed down without being bland.  Prices are a little on the high side, but not by much and only when I order more than I probably should have anyway. Bread is just by request now. I've always left full.

-Enhnf9P_PhrXyWk27f0Dw.text: CPK is one of the few chain restaurants that I LOVE. I love their veggie sandwich, spring mix salad, roasted veggie sandwich, tequila fettucine, the broccoli sun-dried tomato fusili. During my trip to vegas, we decided to go to CPK to get some lunch.   What I find odd is that no matter what CPK I go to, the service always seems to suck. Even the CPK I always go to at home, the service sucks! I am just surprised since I know people who work at CPK and I know how strict and intense their training is when people are hired. Regardless, I continue to return because I love the food.  While we were at this location, the service was just blah and SO SLOW. the restaurant was empty, but it took forever to get our food. On top of that, they didn't have the AC on and it was so hot and stuffy in the restaurant that everyone I ate with was uncomfortable and sneezing. After we complained, they turned the AC on and it got much better. I was just really surprised no one else in the restaurant complained. But anyone who works at the restaurant should know that the AC should be on in a restaurant. I knew it was off cause once we complained, I felt the AC blowing on me. *End of rant*

8ACsZCmtr7DOxTP2zX8AZA.text: Delicious food and courteous service provided by staff from the beginning to end of your dining experience. We are excited for the brand to be opening in Summerlin as well as we have frequented Town Square as a local destination.

xOKLLmDXn4X5J-K7h4esog.text: We have eaten here a few times.   Service was always good. We had a server named Katie twice in a row and loved having her take care of us.   I can say my favorite dish hands down is the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti. I have had it twice now and is just amazingly delicious.  The wife is gluten free and said the crust is delicious. She gave me a piece and I can say, it is pretty good. (I love my regular crust loaded with gluten!)  We will continue to go there for the service and quality of food.

aTLy0QZQbtoK4CiLAdhSEw.text: Everyone was super nice! We walked in and the hostesses greeted us immediately with warmth and smiles. We were seated right a way. Looking around it was very clean and modern. Lots of seating.   Our server asked if we had ever been here before. We said no. I ordered a mojito and it was really good and refreshing. We both had a pizza each. My friend got the carnitas pizza sooo good! And I had the Hawaiian. It was good but too much green stuff on top. I think it was shredded green onion, not sure but I pulled most of it off. We had the Thai spring rolls (2) ok those were interesting in a good way. Loved the peanut dip that came with them. They were more of a taquito than a spring roll. Rolled up in a flower tortilla.   The manager visited our table prior to our food coming and after the bread olive oil arrived. She gave us one of the new flat breads. It was all cheese and some sage. It was interesting. Tasted like nachos for some reason. I can't stand sage. So it isn't something I would order. But it was free food so you know I ate it! With all the appetizers I was soooo full that I ate only two pieces of my pizza. Then had to go back to work and smell pizza until I got home and at it for dinner

RKUIrc7St9p8Y84LyiEm6Q.text: Its been a long time since ive been to CPK. This most recent time, we had decided to come to CPK for dinner for something small, prior to an event nearby. We had arrived around 630-645ish and were seated within 5 minutes. We had opt'ed to sit outside because the weather had been amazing these past few days. One side to outdoor seating was already full. The other side had two 2-person tables left.   Our waiter had came fairly soon after we had been seated and got our drink orders placed. We had both opted for a "uniquely non-alcoholic" drink  Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler which consisted of fresh strawberries hand-shaken w/ Fresca and Monin South Seas, featuring natural flavors of mango, guava, and ginger.   Not too sweet. Quite refreshing. Nice to enjoy on a nice day out :) We both had enjoyed our drinks. I ate her strawberries too. There was a slice of lime in the drink too ! No i didnt eat that Lol   ---------------------------  Along with our drink orders, we had ordered some food as well. Not too much, but enough to hold us until the event which had desserts and champagne provided.. XD   Before our food came out, we were served with some fresh warm bread with a small bowl of olive oil and herb. The bread was super tasty and fresh. Nice crispy crust and soft inside. The olive oil and herb tasted really nice as well !   Spinach Artichoke Dip served hot with housemade blue & white corn tortilla chips  Surprisingly for an appetizer, its quite the large portion of dip. Their housemade chips were thin and crispy. The dip isnt too overpowering/strong but creamy and delicious. Yummy !   Carne Asada Pizza w/ tender marinated steak, fire-roasted poblanos, cilantro pesto, yellow onions, mozzarella, monterey jack cheese and fresh cilantro served with housemade salsa verde  This was like... a taco as a pizza. "New item" on the menu. Lol the steak was indeed tender, topped with the side of housemade salsa verde really made this like a taco. Very tasty. Fairly decent to try ! Ingredients melded pretty nice and worked well together.   Even with this amount of food, we still had 2 slices of pizza leftover, which i had taken home to eat as a snack later that night HAHA !   ------------------------  Overall, great experience. Was nice to enjoy the nice outdoor weather while its lasts cuz everyone knows vegas weather is bipolar. Also nice to have a nice partner to enjoy it with hehe

VP46f0LZH42zc-8VBG2_jg.text: Very slow service.  Waiter kept blaming it on the kitchen.  We ordered a lettuce wrap which took an hour to get (he forgot to put the order in).  I ordered the carne asada pizza which had 2 pieces of steak for $17.00.   I'm writing this as I'm waiting for my waiter to take my card and process the payment, which has now taken 16 minutes.  Total time was 2-1/2 hours.

YBBxGs8woYRW2yqGOZ2RLw.text: Somehow I just dined at CPK (as people tell me it's called) for the first time. This location is conveniently located smack in the middle of Town Square near Whole Foods and The Container Store.  We arrived just before noon and waited a few minutes to be seated. The restaurant was nearly full for lunch on a weekday. Once seated our waitress came over soon after to take our drink orders and then our food orders when we were ready. She didn't waste time getting orders in, but didn't rush us to order either.  The menu has a nice variety of options and they definitely offer more than just pizza. The lunch combination option had quite a few items to choose from and was reasonably priced. It includes pizza, sandwiches, soups, and salads. There were fun drink options like non-alcoholic refreshers and teas too. Calorie counts are listed next to each item which made it easy to make a smarter choice.  I went with the combination of Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza and a Caesar Salad. The salad was tasty and I liked the garlic croutons. The pizza was a nice size. I liked the overall flavor and the crust on the pizza. We had to pass on dessert since we were on a lunch break, but they had some good looking options that I'd love to try next time.

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Duo - Caesar Salad &amp; Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza

BneOiM5i4nwjyBAU9f252Q.text: Met up with the wife today for lunch at California Pizza Kitchen. We ordered waters and were delivered some warm fresh bread with oil and herbs. I added some balsamic vinegar to make it just right.   This location was recently remodeled and has a new fresh look inside. The staff was very warm and welcoming and even brought us out a Bianco Flatbread for coming in today. This included whipped truffle cream, gorgonzola, mozzarella cheeses and fresh sage. Very nice of them.  For the meal we decided on splitting a full size Thai Crunch, we could have had a half size but now I have some leftovers for dinner. The salad was delicious and comes with crisp veggies and fresh cilantro, chicken and peanuts, wontons and rice sticks, then it's tossed in a Thai peanut dressing. We also added fresh avocado to the salad ($3 up charge).  The avo complemented the salad and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Thank you CPK  for a great lunch.

EKqitinmuBtwJHToNxfuFQ.text: California Pizza Kitchen has always felt overrated to me but then again I guess it's because I don't like eating at places that don't keep it real about the ingredients that they use. That's a different review though let me give some credit where it is due! Specifically for this visit to the Town Square location my co worker invited me to a nice business lunch. We arrived and of course the place was packed because hello it's lunch time duh!   Talked to the hostess about the wait and was quayside maybe 15 minutes. 20 minutes later we were finally seated and I can't be made because hey it was only 5 minutes of a difference! I was looking for something light and not really in the mood for pizza but seriously who declines a free lunch? Not me!   Ahh but if course they have an extensive menu with alternate options so why not be open to a spinach And quinoa said with a nice piece of Salmon on top! Sounds good to me! I washed it down with one of the new refreshing cucumber mint drinks! Super yummy and out server made it an effort to not let my glass stay empty that was the best part! The full portion salad is huge and I really should've down the lunch size but whatever it was so worth it! The service here was amazing so I really have to come back again this time not for business so I can have a great cocktail! Great job CPK!

f5UtrZ8k4tYck0YXjIaFcg.text: I love coming here for lunch, especially when you have been busy shopping or have had a full schedule working. It is central, easy to get to and there is plenty of parking at Town Square.   I went there again last week with a friend and it was as good as always! You can also order your Pizza with a cauliflower crust for those who want to avoid wheat or gluten or simply have an alternative.  I got the shrimp scampi pizza and I ordered it with a cauliflower crust. It was absolutely delicious!!! Fresh ingredients, extremely tasty and the cauliflower crust is a total winner! It's my new favorite!   The staff are very friendly, they came by to check on our meal, topped up our tea and made sure we had everything we needed.  It's a popular place so can be busy, expect a 15 minute wait at lunch time, it can be less if you want to sit at the bar.   The booths are very roomy and comfy and my place of choice to sit. For me this place is worth the wait as it is consistently good every time I go there. They have great salads and great choice of menu. And for  Pizza lovers, this place is excellent!!!

5aFBVr10pI-4q1RkC9ep1g.text: If you are hungry or thirsty and are craving amazing service, you must go to CPK in town square!! My friend and I sat down at the bar and Dylan took our drink order and asked if we wanted some warm bread as we perused the menu. We laughed and told him about our previous experience at the other place and said we've had plenty of bread because that's practically all we got at the other place. El2mvAsV7TS6hMMZY5kNOQ.text: I love CPK! I came to the one over at Town Square for a quick lunch with some friends. I love how the menu offers small plates and meals on the lighter side.  I ordered my food from the small plates section. I had my own asparagus and arugula salad and split the Bianco flatbread with my friend.   The arugula salad was perfectly light and not drenched in dressing like some salads are. It was a complete balance of bitterness from the arugula and sweetness from the fire roasted tomatoes. The cheese was sliced so thin that you could see through it, so it also gave the salad a nice savory touch.  The Bianco flatbread was stunningly delicious. It was brushed with a thin layer of truffle oil and garnished with a little bit of greens and covered in mozzarella cheese. Within every bite was a whiff of truffle oil. It was a definite five stars overall for the food.  I knocked off a star from my rating of CPK because our waitress seemed to be new at her job. She was nervous while taking our order, but she was kind and quick enough to serve us complimentary bread with oil (which wasn't the best bread I've ever indulged on).  However, when we were finished with our food, she came to get our plates, and because she seemed nervous, she accidentally dropped one of our plates on the table and broke it. We knew it was an accident, but I saw the manager standing close by looking at us, and she didn't do anything about it.  However, my experience was wonderful at CPK minus the part where the service was a little lacking in confidence and management. I'll definitely be back, but will be hoping for another server.

AwqxNvY9T033yZqX_oc4ww.text: We came for a date night around 7pm on a Tuesday night. So obviously it wasn't busy, there was only people at the booths- no tables. They warned us they were in construction and they were sorry the floors were tore up. It didn't bother us though, no construction was being done at that time!  On to the food! We ordered spinach and artichoke dip for appetizers and we finished it right before our food arrived. It's sad I was pleasantly surprised by this because half the time they come out with the food! The chips seemed a little stale but the dip was amazing, it wasn't chunky which I enjoyed better. We than shared mahi mahi tacos (with avocado $1.25 more) and a thin crust three meat pizza. The mahi mahi tacos were huge and very delicious, the avocado was also perfect! The pizza was a little spicy and we liked all the meat it had to offer!!  Side note if you sign up for their rewards on your next visit you get a free small plate. I signed up on the spot and now it shows I have a free small plate and $10 off of $40! Pretty awesome and we will be back Friday with our little one!

drzMgP0-y5paQS7-0tekVg.text: I've been to a lot of different pizza kitchens across America and honestly I have to say that this was the last place to try on my list. Now I definitely regret even putting this on my to do list, or my "tackle the yummy" list.  It's a typical Sunday in Las Vegas, hot and windy. I Mountaintown Square on Las Vegas Blvd. and I'm hungry. So of course I would love to go try something new. Hence California pizza kitchen. So my mother arrives we decide to go in and try it.   All I can say is disappointing! The food lackluster and locked flavor. The presentation was less than heart. And the prices were outrageous. Not to mention their major competitor is Sammy's woodfired pizza. Sammy is offers gluten-free variations of pastas and crusts to appeal to a wider variety of people. To my surprise California pizza kitchen only has five pizzas that you can get the gluten-free crust and has absolutely no other gluten-free menu and no gluten-free pasta. Being a celiac this was disappointing!   Now let's talk about the service. The gentleman seated us was very nice and the weather was nice but completely uneducated in anything that has to do with any aspect of anything Culinary. When I inquired about if they had pasta that was made without me because my son had a dairy allergy he replied "well the only pasta with diary is going to be our fettuccine Alfredo or mac & cheese."obviously I know that Alfredo and macaroni and cheese obviously has "cheese" and has Dairy. So why would I order that for my son? Wouldn't. Again I stated "no, my son has all dairy allergies including eggs. So again that your pasta have eggs?" He quickly ran to go check and came back and stated that all their pasta egg. Again very disappointing.  All in all besides the lack of a gluten-free menu, the lack of ambience, the lack of an educated staff, and the outrageous prices, the food  was lack luster and was not visually appealing. Tasteless food never is a recipe for success. Maybe there other restaurants have better chefs? Maybe that's how they got so big? I'm not sure, however I am not on the California pizza kitchen bandwagon!

fQcD53ACnduoxxbbopAqDw.text: I thought I was ordering a delicious strawberry shortcake but what I got was entirely different... When my waiter brought out the dessert it was how you say different then the advertising. It looked like cornbread had been fried with mushy, lemon tasting strawberries on top. wtJp82ZepP3c6tUnTN_kCA.text: Good food and reasonable prices. Fast service. We were seated immediately and our order was taken and placed right after we sat down. However , had to wait a bit before receiving our drink order. The Food came out fast and was very good. We did ask to see if the could put the Rams vs. Seahawks football game on Channel 5. She tried to set it up, but was unable to. We were told that they were unable to get the game so they put soccer on instead. Bummer. CPK  is always good.

YxUofz3CAW8DbUQEEpOI0w.text: I work in Town Square and stopped by CPK to grab a to-go order. The girls helping me were friendly, fast, and thorough. My salad is delicious (Thai crunch) everything tastes so fresh and they even allowed me to sub no chicken add avocado at no extra price - which is above and beyond awesome - most places won't let you. The name on my receipt says that Chelsea helped me. I'm definitely a satisfied customer, thank you!

YTcQ9FHHtQeKXwzcpmSbQw.text: We were quoted a 10-15 min wait on a Saturday evening, and we were called within the quoted time.  The hostess wasn't in a race seating us and took the time to talk to us and walk at our pace.  Our server Damon made an excellent recommendation for an appetizer, and he made sure to let us know our pizza would take a little longer because it was gluten free (good to know).  Excellent follow up service making sure everything was perfect.  When we were ready to leave, Damon was check ready and had our ticket processed quickly.  The only reason for a 4-star rating is serving size.  For the cost, the pizza could be a little larger.  Overall, I would highly recommend this location as the service and taste of food is excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free small plate when registering for CPK Pizza Dough app

p0X5n8IsmG90YX-q_tOULQ.text: Came here while on vacation. It was my first time at this particular location, but I've been to CPK many times in the past. I ordered my usual-a Thai chicken pizza, BBQ chicken chopped salad, and the side by side soup with smashed pea and tortilla. The pizza was drenched in bean sprouts and carrots. I know that's part of the topping, but I've never seen them put so much. It really overpowered the pizza and made it soggy. The salad didn't have enough dressing and I paid extra for avocado which came with 4 tiny pieces. The soup was cold when it was served. Only good thing was the service, hence the 2 stars.  Btw, I came in an hour before closing.

jPQV3_azL9iIjnlFoEcRSg.text: We got the Chicken Club Salad....Tomato Full size pizza...I think 3 Cheese Pizza.  Anyway...I would eat here everyday...We normally drink water...Save the Money for a Tip......This Pizza was Amazing!!!!   Salad Too!  Keep up the great Work!

cUhphy_RpqWSv2W7tqlb3Q.text: Yelp has transformed me into a chain restaurant avoider. Well, I'm not anti-chain; I just prefer to find local places instead. So when my cousins wanted to have a birthday dinner at CPK last night, I was pretty meh about the idea.  Don't get me wrong. I've always liked CPK. Last night was no exception. Our server, Rachel (from Maryland by way of Austin), was overly friendly. She was so bubbly, it was almost exhausting. At her suggestion, I ended up getting a Kiwi Frozen Lemonade with a shot of Absolut. Excellent suggestion. It was very good! By the way, their White Sangria is also delicious.  I didn't plan on eating, but CPK has such a wide selection of salads, I couldn't resist getting their Moroccan Chicken Salad. I should have gone with a half because that thing was huge! And boy was it delicious. I especially like it for the roasted butternut squash, dates, beets, avocado, and toasted almonds. Yum!  Well done CPK.

tv8YhLsTjfdVZe1rndGuUg.text: When I used to visit California as a child we would go to CPK and get the Italian pizza - which was my favorite. So, recently we went to CPK and I obviously ordered the Italian pizza and it was nothing like I remember it. Total bummer - I still give 3 stars since the rest of the pizzas I tried were good, but what happened to the italian....

r_2SFmzbFHiQaIdINUxbIQ.text: Who cares if it's a chain? The food and service here was great. I can't say the same for the host 'cause she insisted we sit out in the patio in 106-degree weather 'cause it was packed inside.   The BBQ Chicken Pizza and Avocado Egg Rolls are not adventurous choices but they do the job well and are recommended for first timers. You'll find "California-inspired" dishes here; basically American favorites with ingredients and preparation that's non-conventional, fusion or maybe even rebellious like Kung Pao Spaghetti or Thai Chicken Pizza.  CPK is a classy choice if you want a break from delivery pizzas or ummmm those microwavable pizzas -_-

d1MXde-l2O7hDU8O8hj79A.text: So I just left CPK about 10 minutes ago and couldn't wait to write this review. I've been to this location as well as others and have never received the terrible service I received today. We waiting for 15 minutes for a table...not a problem! It was myself and my 4 kids on a lunch date. Once we got seated, rosabel took our drink order. It was 15 minutes before we got our drinks. When she brought our drinks, she took our food order. By now it was 1245pm.  We then waited another 20 minutes before Angie came and asked if we were ok and brought us bread. She said she understands how it can be with 4 kids so here's some bread to pass the time. First off, it's part of the service.  That was also the first time anyone came to check on our table since they took our order. We then waited for another 30 minutes before Angie came back and apologized for the wait and said she would have her manager come by to see what they could do for us since we waited for over an hour by this point. Shortly after her apology, the food came. We ate and at that point finally got our first refill on our drinks. Once we finished, Angie came back to see if we needed boxes and to bring the check.  The manager never came by like Angie said and the total bill for such service was over $50. Angie said she would be back to collect payment. We waiting another 10 minutes and finally I had my daughter walk it to her. Rosabel then brought it back and we walked out of the restaurant 2 hours after walking in. Definitely not the best experience and very reluctant to go back.
