lH1d1n67IHrqkYV842JPKQ.text: I must say:  Pleasantly Surprised!  I enjoyed this one even more so than the one located in the Mirage Hotel.  They now have a 'low calorie' menu, it's definitely more pricey than their other menu, but sometimes you have to pay not to be tempted.  You can go online and download a full and comprehensive caloric menu from their website.  For instance, ordering the pizza thin crust makes a pretty big difference.  Our server was very bubbly and attentive, she was their corporate trainer based on the pin on her lapel, dark hair really cute glasses.   They have 1/2 salads and full portions too, which is nice. I ordered the under 500 calorie shrimp scampi zucchini pasta--I loved it. Especially for being healthy. It had tons of garlic and a lot of flavor. I added spinach and roasted red peppers to it for some more veggies. I'm going to try and replicate it at home. It was very very good.  My friend ordered lettuce wraps [chicken and shrimp which somehow has more calories & fat than just the chicken or just the shrimp? which is confusing but whatever] she ate 'em up. Her husband ordered a 1/2 salad which he finished in it's entirety and then managed to eat a couple of her lettuce wraps.  Food took a little longer than I would've liked to come out, but it was very busy. Would also love if they served some pizza bread for a starter [even though that is not on the diet].  1/2 salad & 1/2 pizza option would be very nice too.  Music was very loungey this time I felt like I was in a nightclub, kind of techno funky was unusual but I didn't mind it.  I also took out a to-go order for one of our co-workers, when I was walking out the manager basically bolted to open the door for me [and he was in mid discussion with the hostess]. I *love*  men with manners. A+

dgkUMhZc3-iqur7SAhcJwg.text: Ordered $100+ of food delivery via PostMates.... 1.   I paid $2 extra for shrimp & $2 extra for fish added to my salad & asked to not have the chicken in my salad (I eat seafood but no red meat or chicken /pescetarian)...I got chicken & no fish or shrimp & paid an extra $4 for that  2. Ordered 3 pizzas & they were different sizes (2 small & 1 large & they are small enough to begin with). Wtf?  Why were they different sizes?  Also one of pizzas wasn't covered in cheese, you could see the dough blank of anything. 4.   We usually get some bread as we do when we're in the restaurant & I've gotten it when I've picked up my own To Go orders, but not this time (my kids love the bread). 5. Luckily I also had gotten them pasta dish as well (which was good).  The only reason it gets 2 stars is bcz if you go into restaurant it's better as you can ask for corrections & the good does taste good. EIrrli_8jCZJLprJAm0uhQ.text: There's a lot of places to get pizza here in town, and when you ask about it you typically get a lot of names, from the local restaurants like Metro Pizza and Angelina's to the chains. One of those chains -- California Pizza Kitchen -- is among my favorite pizza joints in town, representing West Coast-style pizza; for that I have a completely different pizza place in mind, which I will discuss in a future review. For now, though, I will focus on CPK!  I came out here with my mother and her work friends a week or so ago as part of their monthly outings, and CPK tends to not be too busy during the weekdays. It's usually the weekends, like the Friday we came in, that we need a reservation. In our case, though, we were able to get a table relatively quickly. Though we ordered a lot of food, I will specifically focus on my menu items -- the tomato basil bisque, the roasted vegetable salad, the roasted garlic chicken pizza, and the strawberry shortcake a la mode.  I arrived later than everyone this time around, so I was the last to order -- despite that, my food came out at the same time as everyone else's, which I appreciated! However, my mother and her companions noted that we had trouble flagging down our server for napkins, refills, and even the checks, which detracted somewhat from our experience.  Food-wise, I started with the tomato bisque and roasted vegetable salad -- both of which were light, refreshing and very flavorful! In particular, their tomato soup actually tasted like tomatoes, and wasn't overly sweet like other soups that I had. The salad had a very light but refreshing dressing that helped bring it and the roasted vegetables together -- both of these items could have made for a light meal by themselves!  Afterwards, my roasted garlic chicken pizza came out -- and the first thing I noticed was that it had plenty of garlic, which I appreciate since I love a lot of garlic on my food! ( Not so much a good thing if you plan to speak to people or go out with someone later -- neither of which I was doing after the meal. ) The pizza was delicious -- crisp inside, fluffy and chewy crust, and plenty of toppings that ensure that I'd finish it off completely.  As it was one of the seasonal specials, I just had to order the strawberry shortcake and add ice cream to it -- and I will admit I had mixed feelings about it. On the one hand, it was deliciously sweet and refreshing, and the ice cream was a nice touch. On the other, though, I wasn't much of a fan of the sweet biscuit that they used as the shortcake base. My preference is for the pound cake instead -- other than that, it was an enjoyable dessert.  Like I said, CPK is one of my favorite pizza chains in town, and the issues I had about the service and the dessert recipe aren't enough to keep me from returning in the future! Of all the dining options at Town Square, this and P.F. Chang's are among my favorites, and it's hard not to see why. Hopefully you like this place too if you decide to stop by while you're in Town Square!

ChnclZVnvdPLS8CZA0HjLA.text: Decided that wanted really good take out, and the twins wanted pizza in some form. So to the yelp app and found what I wanted from a prior couple of visits to the CA Pizza Kitchen. Ordering was smooth and no issues at all, but the time that I was given was way over an hour. Actually from the time that I placed the order it was 2.5 hours , but is was delivered to my house.   I ordered two pepperoni pizzas which were great and perfect. The crispy Mac and cheese bites were cold and reheating them in the microwave did not save them. The shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread was so very good and rich. The Asparagus salad was really good too. I ordered an order of Mexican street corn which was so perfect. The goat cheese made it. They did forget the street corn but I had within thirty minutes. And for dessert I ordered red velvet cake which was amazing and so perfect with the cream and sugar content. The strawberry shortcake looked like someone shook it up so I did not get to eat it. Aside from all of our food being shaken up it was good.

I4flvmeGdPQKY1UdSDIXYA.text: I haven't been here in years, but I had a pleasant experience when I dined at CPK a couple days ago. This place has been renovated and now looks more modern and clean. The only bad thing I can say is that when we were first led to our table, someone had left dirty plates on what was supposed to be a clean table. Our hostess apologized and quickly had someone clean our table. Our waiter was very attentive and quick to get our drink/food orders. And our food tasted delicious! I always used to come to CPK often with my family when I was little. I'm glad they still have the Avocado Club Rolls, which are so savory and crunchy. The chipotle ranch sauces matches well with it. This was also my first time every trying the Thai Chicken Pizza and I don't know why I waited until now to try it! It's very good, no wonder it's a CPK favorite.

8C3dS-ZadUbjBODCbykiDA.text: CPK has never been a restaurant that gives you a "WOW" factor. Instead, it's a typical chain restaurant offering mediocre food. This visit was no different.  Caesar salad was average. My Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza was average (would've preferred a little more chicken and scallions, but the garlic was just right). Our waitress was attentive without hovering, polite and friendly without being robotic. The sangria flight was actually very tasty and had a bit of a kick. And 3-ounce pours was actually larger than I thought they'd be.  Patio seating: DON'T do it. Although it is nice to sit outside on a cool Sunday evening to eat dinner with your loved one, the constant sound of planes overhead on approach to McCarran is a bit of a mood killer. I guess you don't realize the close proximity that Town Center is to the airport until you have to yell across the table.

vHqIPj-jypOqS_dOhjyCFA.text: Dear CPK,  I have to say I am fed up with food establishments capitalizing on trends in the food industry with little to no understanding (or have respect) of what the concept is in the first place.  Which brings to me your "power bowls", CPK. I ordered your bahn mi power bowl.  a. Have you had a power bowl b. Have you had a bahn mi?  How you manage to call something bahn mi and magically remove all flavor, including heat and acid, is beyond me. But the worst, all I can say is; Wendy's called, they want their salad back.  Unfortunately, this sad salad paled in comparison to our service. Thank goodness we ordered a bottle of wine to share or we would have never seen another drink. The bartender was absent so I was stuck with a soggy tasteless salad....I mean "power bowl".   From terrible service to misrepresting menu items I have to say CPK, you're corporatism is showing.

VJ0R09iVErMF2h_feVUP-g.text: I've been here like two or three times before and I never was disappointed with their service and food here. I came by around 6:30pm on Tuesday and got seated at a table really quick with my friend. Our server was super nice and friendly. I had saw on Yelp that if you signed up for their CPK Rewards, you can get a free small plate (btw that includes the flat breads as well). I asked him about the rewards and gave him my code from the app and ordered the Bianca Flat Bread. A few minutes later, he came back and said that my reward wasn't found and I told him it was strange since the reward shown I had to use it within 119 mins. He told me if I just signed up for the CPK Rewards, I can only use the "small plate" reward on my NEXT visit, not on the same day. Being so nice, he went to talk to his manager and both of them came back telling us they took care of it for us and we didn't need to pay for the flat bread. I thought that was very kind of them to do that, even though I had misunderstood the reward program. We of course, have him a good tip for the great gesture. The server definitely took the extra steps to accommodate for us and try to make us happy. Thank you.   Anyways, onto the food. Like I mentioned, the Bianca flatbread was so good!! Cheesy goodness! Very crispy and sufficient size for me and my friend to eat. Next was our BBQ Chicken salad, I order a half size. It was simple and the chicken to salad ratio wasn't the best. I was surprised how little of the BBQ chicken was given. Then we moved onto the Thai Chicken pizza on a cauliflower crust. Now this crust was interesting. I have tried some other cauliflower crusted pizzas before and CPK was kinda strange to me only because it tasted chewy. We thought we were eating a gluten-free crust. I'm not saying it was bad, it was good actually, but it was definitely interesting.   Lastly were our drinks. I am a big Moscow Mule fan and that's my go to cocktail drink and I liked this. I like my Moscow Mules with a lot of ginger beer and this had it! I got a Tropical Mule, their seasonal drink right now. In addition to the ginger beer, it had rum and passionfruit juice served in a cute copper pot. Also had some candied ginger and a small orange slice skewered on a toothpick. Really cute! My friend got the Hand Shaken Agave Mojito. It came with a small stick of sugar cane, so be sure to chew on it, it's sweet! He said he enjoyed the drink and both of ours were very refreshing.    Overall, like I said before I haven't been disappointed with this CPK at Town Square. :)

l7Wkk24p8WlVz-4FZZsFoA.text: CPK is one of my favorite restaurants (after Cheesecake Factory). The pizza is great, but my favorite dishes are their salads. The Thai Crunch Salad includes edamame, peanuts, rice sticks, wonton strips, and a terrific peanut dressing. By ordering the dinner portion and only eating half, I can take home the remainder with extra dressing. When added to lettuce, my leftovers can make 2-3 more meals.  They serve bread and olive oil automatically at each table. The bread is made fresh and very tasty (as is the olive oil).  Employees at this and other CPKs have always been very professional in their service to customers.  When traveling, CPK is a great place to pick up a to-go order to eat back in your hotel room. Call ahead and you'll be out the door in no time at all.

M_jYRItcB4-m-HN1DJnqRg.text: Today my mom and I have experienced the most pleasurable eating experience of our lives! The service was incredible and it was great to see all the staff work as a TEAM! :) Our food in turn came out just as delicious!!!  My mom got the Pesto Cream Penne which she said was not drowning in too much sauce and she pretty much devoured it all! I had the Fish Tacos w/ avacado which, by the way I can see why it is a CPK favorite! Just the right amount fish and it came with salsa and chips. Boy, that was mouth watering! We also enjoyed a couple of drinks along with our meals. To be specific mango mojito, strawberry mango cooler and a strawberry rhubarb martini and whoever the bartender is THANK YOU! Drinks were not over powering but tasted flavorful! We ended the meal with this amazing butter cake!!!! Off the chain....no joke its just the right amount of decadent w/ a hint of deadly ;)   Overall, such a great afternoon and the ability of the staff to work as a team and smiles all around really reflected upon the food which was beyond amazing :) We also got to meet the manager Haley who was super delightful! You have return customers for sure CPK!! :)

_FmP5sZChalvZKC1AZEtjg.text: This CPK located in the center of Town Square mall is like any other CPK. Not to say it is bad but a very typical solid experience you get at any national chain restraunt. My review is of their new gulten free menu.  It is awesome! They have for pizzas to chose from: BBQ chicken, pepperoni, margherita, and mushroom pepperoni sausage. Right when you you walk and ask the hostess for a gf menu they know what you are talking about, which is nice. The waiters are also well trained and very familiar with the gluten free options. When ever you order gluten free the manager comes over and explains their process of avoiding cross contamination and then hand delivers the pizza to you.  The pizza are delicious and high quality. They use a different  gluten free crust, it is about 14 inches in diameter and tastes just like a regular thin crust pizza, or so my girlfriend  says.  Keep it up CPK! Thank for being serious about your gluten free options.

tSxbADqv611qsX2cEglPtQ.text: Such a great date night on Thursday! This is one of our favorite places and we always like to try new things when we go. We were seated in the bar area and the bartender was certainly busy but also managed to take care of us and provide excellent service. (Our bill said his name was Eric Michael).   I was trying to try something new that I could have for dinner and lunch the next day and I got the garlic cream fettuccine and it was a great choice! It was a big portion of pasta and the sauce with a little cheese on top was perfect. My boyfriend has the Shanghai bowl and added Salmon and said it was delicious. He is more of a healthy eater (at times) and this was perfect for him. Our waiter made sure everything was done in a timely manner, and our food came out perfectly.   We look forward to returning again soon!

vEphpvytv-yvodT0s1_bkQ.text: CPK is a regular place for me and it never disappoints . This location was my go to when I was in Vegas .   The food always comes out quick no matter how many people are there and it's always delicious. I love the low carb options that get have too ! The lunch specials are perfect to try a couple different things .   The buffalo cauliflower is a must for me at CPK . I bring all my friends here to make them try it . I could seriously eat it everyday . The Mac and cheese balls are really good to . I've gotten the white corn guacamole a few times and that is also delightful. All the salads I've ever tried here are great . My favorite pizza is a pepperoni pizza with cauliflower crust . Soooo tasty !   I finally tried the summer strawberry shortcake and OMG my mouth is watering just walking about it .   If you are looking for a quick meal at a sit down place  , good prices , and great food and staff. CPK is your place.

AtVtimWxqpT5GJVIWmjS5w.text: We came out to CPK a couple weekends ago for dinner and drinks with the roommates.    We sat at the bar, and Giovanni took care of us.   We ordered:  Crispy Mac n cheese:  AMAZING.  I want these all of the time. Lettuce wraps:  Very flavorful and delicious.  Would absolutely order these again. The Works Pizza:  Spicy Italian sausage, rustic pepperoni, Cremini mushrooms, Mozzarella, red onions, green peppers, olives and wild Greek oregano.  This was good, but that spicy Italian sausage REALLY is spicy, so be careful.  For drinks we both had "Spiked Cucumbers", which is a gin drink.  These were excellent.  Giovanni was a great host/bartender/server.  He made good conversation, put up with our jokes, and was extremely professional.    We would definitely come back, I'd like to try a few more things on the menu!!

XXAj0nJoXRWh6qJPNZkh_g.text: I really just don't think I ordered the right things. My friend and I went in on a Sunday evening at 5:30 and there was a 15/20 minute wait or open seating at the bar. We sat at the bar, which was completely open, and was served quickly. We both got the strawberry lime margarita, which was actually very good it was the best part of the visit.  We chose to share the California Club Pizza and the Avocado Eggrolls. Eggrolls came with two sauces, like a chive ranch and a southwest ranch maybe? I thought they were pretty good but my friend wasn't a fan. The pizza had bacon, chicken, one tomato slice, an avocado slice, and topped with arugula. The pizza was just dry tasting - the bacon and chicken seemed too much and both were dry as well. I tried adding the Eggrolls ranch to the pizza and it didn't help. The arugula was way over powering on the pizza also so we both ended up just taking it off...   Overall not super impressed, the salads everyone had looked great so I'd try that next time. 2 stars for the food and an extra star for the server/bartender - he gave us a free margarita to share because another party changed their mind on what they wanted to drink. Maybe I'll return, but there's so many other options in Town Square I'd probably check someplace else out first.

1hAXZ4rIaj-WyN_ouiMppA.text: Not good for big families (10 guest) over four people. You are not able to make reservations, you can't order off the catering menu while dinning in, a dirty plate was given, after talking to the manager that morning, he wasn't really able to accommodate our party. mVwfTb-Xh7SGse0eX4q_nw.text: I love love love the buffalo cauliflower, it is the bomb here!! They serve it over a bed of thinly sliced celery with blue cheese crumbles. It is absolutely divine as an appetizer !! I also love their pizzas here. I usually get the bbq chicken or their pepperoni/sausage and mushroom. Overall its a great lunch or dinner spot. I wish they had some sort of reward program. If they do I'm unaware, but I've never had any complaints here, staff is real friendly! Will definitely be back.

vszvnAzK9OJWYBkVAML8Tw.text: I've been here many times, since Town Square first opened. They used to be pretty good, but the past few times I've been here the food has been nothing but inconsistent. We always order the same thing: spicy buffalo cauliflower and Thai crunch salad with extra dressing on the side, no cilantro.   Went there today for lunch and ordered the usual. Got our iced water with no straws, server was no where to be found so we grabbed our own straws. The salad and cauliflower came at the same time. She didn't provide us serving spoons for the salad nor did she bring us spoons for the dressing. We had to get another server's attention for spoons because she paid no attention to us while attending other tables. After waiting awhile, we still didn't get our spoons and finally were able to get our server's attention. Then still waited a few minutes and the other server finally brought us spoons. Probably took about 5-10 minutes just to get spoons.   The Thai crunch salad had always been served with crispy cabbages from my experiences. However, the last 2 times I've visited they served us with lettuce, which in my opinion really changes the taste of the salad and defeats the "crunch" description of the salad. The menu says "crisp veggies" so I can't really argue it has to be cabbages but I've never had it with lettuce until the last 2 recent visits.The last time we came, I asked the server and he said they ran out of cabbages. Not sure why they didn't ask if we were okay with lettuce. Sounds like they just slap on whatever veggies they have that day? Very inconsistent. And today, it came with lettuce again.   Halfway through eating we noticed a bunch of cucumber skins in the salad. Looks like they peeled them and left them in there. Some pieces were also not peeled all the way. The cauliflower this time also didn't taste the same as before, it contained less sauce and tasted a little more bland.   Won't be coming back to this location. I recommend the one at fashion show mall, they're consistent and I never experience slow service there.

64xIs3V1i2BNq_Adp1rgNQ.text: I had visited CPK many years ago but never in Nevada, so I decided to try out their lunch. I remember not being impressed when I first visited many years ago, but decided to give it another try since so much time had passed.   I went along with one other person and we arrived when they opened around 11am. The restaurant was pretty much empty and we were seated right away. My first impression was not a good one. We were seated in a booth, and the seats were filthy. It looked like no one wiped them down and they were sprinkled with pizza crumbs.   We were handed the menus and while we were trying to discuss the menu options and what we would share, so we could try a variety of items, we had to lean forward to speak because the music was so loud. When I go to a restaurant, I like to be able to speak to the people I go with. I'm not there to watch the sports on their TV or scroll through social media on my phone. This location completely ruined that portion of the dining experience.   We ordered the small plate of Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese. They were four deep fried macaroni and cheese balls sitting atop some cheese sauce. The macaroni was undercooked. There was absolutely no cheese flavor. It was dry and flavorless, like a ball of fried panko bread crumbs with no seasoning. The cheese sauce was far from creamy- it was watery and did nothing to improve the flavor.   We both ordered their lunch duos. I special ordered a 7 inch shrimp scampi pizza with a tomato basil bisque soup, and they ordered a mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza with the baked potato soup.   Both pizzas, although very different, were similarly horrible. The presentation for the pizzas is deceiving because they both look amazing, but the flavor is just not there. My shrimp scampi pizza was dry, and the arugula on top just made it worse. I tasted no Parmesan, mozzarella, or red chili. Just unseasoned shrimp and chunks of limp onion with arugula. I also got to sample the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza. The first bite was incredibly unpleasant- it was overly seasoned with oregano to the point that you could not taste anything else.  The only pleasant part of the meal were the soups. The tomato basil bisque had a good level of acidity and creaminess. The baked potato soup had very tender potatoes and was well seasoned. There was just enough bacon and green onions and it all came together wonderfully.  When I go to a place with "pizza" in the name, I expect the best part of the meal to be the pizzas. If I had known that the only good part was going to be the soups, I would have just ordered a soup and salad and steered clear of the pizza. The meals were not worth the money and we left very disappointed. 2/5 stars, only because the soups were good.

iWqVcAZMQBjl_M2wzy6Xfw.text: CPK is a chain, but it's always been one of our favorite eateries.   Inside the decor is an upscale casual with servers wearing jeans and black shirts. They have a good mix of booths and tables for seating as well as a large bar.   They don't take reservations, but you can go on the Opentable app or website to get on the seating waitlist ahead of time sort of like call ahead seating.   Join their free pizza dough rewards program, and you will earn points toward rewards with each purchase. You'll also get occasional promotions which are usually good deals.   Service is typically good, but of course it can be hit or miss.   For appetizers I recommend the avocado club egg rolls. Crispy egg rolls full of bacon, chicken, cheese, and avocado. Delicious and crispy though not too oily or greasy (they are fried, though). For pizzas you can't go wrong wrong with the Thai chicken pizza. Bean sprouts, chicken, and a peanut sauce. Excellent! The Hawaiian is also a great choice. Also recommended is the spaghetti bolognese. Perfectly cooked pasta and rich meat sauce. When you're ready for dessert try their tart key lime pie which never disappoints. The salted caramel pudding served in a jar is a newer and also good choice. Overall the food here has always been very good.   CPK is not cheap, though. In particular their desserts are pricey - $7 to $8 each plus $2 if you want ice cream. A bit inflated, yes. A couple will easily spend $50-$60 here without alcohol.   A bit pricey, but it's always a tasty meal at CPK.

kvv3EDSZfsaw9EO4-SCI-A.text: Consistent food and great service, from the hostess, Doris, our server, Dymund. The other half of my party was running late and Doris adjusted the time instead of putting me and guest at the bottom of the list. I also noticed Doris helping to bus tables, work that 90% of the hostesses in this town find beneath themselves. Dymund timed the meal perfectly, and made excellent recommendations. Now if only CPK offered a gluten-free pizza, they'd really be in business. Regardless, thank you Dymund and Doris.

mlRzfyRaxfsPemL0sD8obw.text: This has always been a favorite for us no matter where we've lived.  We don't go as often as we used to but came here because they sent us a coupon for a free dessert, lol, for my husband's birthday.   We usually get sat in a big, comfortable booth.  They have "small bites" appetizers and we tried the mediterranean focaccia bread.  It's really delicious but they don't give enough of the dipping oil, which would be my only complaint about it.    My husband is disappointed because they got rid of his favorite pizza, the bacon cheeseburger pie.  But he really loves their bolognese sauce and always enjoys his pasta dishes.    The waiter kept our glasses full all dinner long, which is something of a lost art in these parts, haha.   The dessert is the real kicker.  All of their desserts are purely gluttonous and amazing.  We've tried almost all of them but the hidden gem is the butter cake!  How could something so simple be so good?!?  And it's a thousand times better if you get it a la mode.  It's so soft and light it literally melts in your mouth.   Of course my other complaint is that I always leave here feeling like a cow because of how much I ate.  But at least I'm not going hungry!   If you haven't had this for a while I think you should definitely rediscover it because the service and the food are pretty awesome for a chain restaurant!

idBVFPVldrS5iJRSJWYaUA.text: Exactly what I expected from CPK, inflated prices, similar menu to what they had 5-10 years ago, and no attention to detail.  My friend started with the wedge salad on the small plates menu. I could see the water dripping off of the lettuce and all the ingredients appeared to be thrown on the plate. Not a good value for almost $6. Next came our entrees, the oriental chicken salad and Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza. Once again, both dishes did not appear thoughtfully made. My salad contained iceberg lettuce, carrots, cabbage, and chicken the only substantial ingredient. The salad was exactly like a mix from the grocery store. The dressing was fine although a little heavy for the ingredients in the salad. My friend was also underwhelmed with her pizza. Her pizza was soaked in BBQ sauce, it was undercooked, and you could tell the quality of the mozzarella was low by the plastic like texture.   CPK I waited years to give you another try to see if the quality and thoughtfulness of your dishes had improved but I see the price of your food is still too high for the ambiance, quality, and plating of your dishes.

3JZ1sEK7qaPw3gwBOFd8WQ.text: Every time I come in here I ask myself why? As I'm looking at the menu I start thinking what other restaurants have better options. I usually try to avoid this restaurant unless it's the one in downtown summerlin. Well I had no choice this last time. I met up with some friends and they all voted for CPK. I tried to stay positive and go with the flow. We go in and are told it'll be at least twenty five minutes. Since there isn't much space to wait and we all had our kids, we decided to go to the Disney art store for a bit.         Once we returned we were automatically seated. The waitress seemed friendly and greeted us within a few minutes, but ordering food and drinks is where the problem came in. She took our drink order and after ten minutes they finally arrived (one alcoholic beverage and three waters). She then comes to take our order and we request if she'll return in one minute. Ten minutes later she returns again. So my friends all order pizza and I order the chicken tequila pasta. Close to 30 minutes later a server brings out the pizza and asked if I ordered anything. I told him I ordered the pasta and all of a sudden he looked really nervous. I was pretty hungry and trying not to over react (I take my food very seriously, it's not that hard to get an order right). The waitress came to us and admitted that my meal was sent to the wrong take and the person at the table already started eating it. She apologized and said she put another order in. When the my pasta came out she was genuinely apologetic. By the end of the meal, she said she took my meal of the tab. I really appreciate restaurants that make mistakes and own up to it, not just make a pathetic excuse and just say sorry. My problem is that this location always messes something up when I come in. Maybe I have a stamp on my head that says "mess up his order" or maybe their job is really that hard? The one think I do know, I'll probably not be returning to this location. The end.

J9BNzZI5J3Gr4bDm1XYAbw.text: California Pizza Chicken... in Nevada!!   (get your own pizza chicken  ....)  Went here for my cousins graduation dinner with a party of about 17, and we all ended up sitting outside in the patio, SEPARATELY. It would have been nicer if they could have seated all of us at one big table formed by many little ones, instead separating the whole family. ;(  I ended up sitting with my dad and uncle, both who ordered fish tacos while I ordered the wild mushroom pizza. All which came with complimentary bread and oil. Let me cut to the chase:  - WILD MUSHROOM PIZZA I was very disappointed after trying this pizza. The crust may have been perfectly soft, but for 13.99? I don't think so. It was not even that good.  - FISH TACOS I stole one of my dad's fish taco's and thought they were bomb. The two avocado slices helped finish me off into oblivion. However, the tortilla and fish was a little to dry for me.  - BREAD AND OIL All though these were complimentary, I actually enjoyed eating these more than the pizza and tacos. The bread might have been a little too hard on the outside, but it was so dam soft on the inside. Combined with the oil, I would have been fine just eating this instead of the main dishes!!  - SERVICE I think something was wrong with our server.. She told me that my pizza will be out "shortly". I soon realized she said that 20 minutes ago. 20 minutes is not short!!!!  My uncle also asked for a refill for his beer, which ended up taking 10 minutes to refill -_-. She didn't even apologize!!

ey-q38RngqcpkCzZUC2uOg.text: After visiting The container Store for a longer span of time than we thought we would, it was high time for dinner.  Eyeballing the several offerings of Town Square, we came across this California Pizza Kitchen.  There was a wait everywhere on this Friday night, but here it didn't appear to be intolerable.  So, we put in our name and waited to be called.  After about 20 minutes the lights on our pager finally glowed red and danced about.  Now hungrier than ever, we prepared to settle in our comfortable booth and enjoy a multi-course dinner at a relaxed pace.  We were not ready to rumble, but to EAT!  So, I began with Minced Chicken Lettuce Wraps, while Diane looked forward to an opening side of Traditional Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese.  The Lettuce Wraps were excellent, featuring fine chicken, tiny curved water chestnuts, jalapeno circles, very fresh and crisp lettuce leaves, and a nice soy-based spicy dipping sauce.  I did find though that the Cherry Limeade I also ordered was too strong for my taste.  The Mac 'N' Cheese had an excellent crisp crust, and was firm on the inside--not mushy.  The whole dish was quite yummy.  Unfortunately our Garlic Cream Fettuccine entrees then arrived right on top of our starters.  I sent mine back, but Diane accepted hers, which contained sauteed chicken and shrimp.  When my entree arrived again at a more suitable time, it was just like Diane's, except mine was further enhanced by sauteed mushrooms.  The sauteing was first-rate, the fettuccine was al dente, and just enough Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce clung to the pasta to make this a truly delectable dish.  The portions were large, with an ample amount of chicken breast chunks and medium- to large-sized shrimps.  We both enjoyed our hot entrees immensely.  But how is a fine dinner truly complete without a sumptuous dessert?  So, I finished with a towering slice of 6-layer Lemon Cake with Lemon Custard Filling, while Diane dug into a large slice of 5-layer Red Velvet Cake.  My high-caloric sweet treat was brushed with Limoncello, candied lemon zest, and Mascarpone Frosting, and was very lemony and delicious.  Diane's was topped by a creamy and very tasty Cream Cheese Frosting.  We were both in dessert nirvana.  One other service delay must be mentioned.  Diane seemed to wait forever for a Hot Chocolate.  We were ultimately told by both our server and the manager that the bartender on duty makes all Hot Chocolate drinks, and got behind making that and other ordered drinks.  Finally, the manager hustled over to our table with the Hot Chocolate way late, but did take it off the bill.  And then Diane found it to be too thin.  Even though our dining experience was marred by two service errors, the food was so delicious that we just brushed these minor inconveniences aside, and this outing still rated an overall 4-1/2 stars!

YUGxQflwNfoJNztiXQMU-g.text: Can't really give a fair review about the food cause we never got that far.  Checked with the hostess about a booth for two and was told a small wait please have a seat. After sitting down in the waiting area two separate couples also checked in after us.  Well one couple, who came in after us, was escorted to a booth. I thought perhaps they called in for reservations and no big deal. Then after an additional longer wait the second couple was escorted to a booth. I couldn't believe it so I went up to the hostess and asked what was going on?  She could only say she was sorry and it would be just a few minutes longer as they cleaned a booth.  I advised that I would like to speak with the manager after we get seated. The two of us was seated in a booth big enough to sit eight.  Unreal!  When the manager arrived I explained what occurred, and she was apologetic. I pointed out that families were waiting in the sitting area and we could not take this large booth while they waited as it wasn't right. I explained that we would just leave so she offered a rain check.  We refused the rain check and departed.  I can only say hospitality starts at the front door, and should extend throughout the establishment, but we didn't really feel it inside, and we do have choices where we wish to spend our money.  California Kitchen was one of our first choices but won't be a choice in the future.

4Fg1Tnn8xWQE4QvfaW-swA.text: I came here for a quick lunch during my lunch day. Generally I don't like to spend too much money on lunch (cause day after day, that adds up quickly), but I was craving some four cheese pasta. A friend said she thinks CPK had it, so we went there.  It was busy, and staff was friendly. We got seated after a few minute wait, and our server was nice and generally pretty efficient. I ordered the four cheese ravioli even though it was a bit more than I wanted to spend (like 14 bucks I believe).   It was pretty "meh." It really wasn't that cheesy, and for four cheeses being in there, I would have thought there would be more flavor. It was bland, the sauce with it was just alright, and all together I was disappointed in the meal.   I haven't tried this location before, but I have also never tried the ravioli at CPK. Maybe it's just not a good dish there.

f-7Ny4wNGhu6wA3IoW8SCA.text: Slow service, not the greatest pizza.   We used to go to CPK on a regular basis, but they seem to be going downhill.  We try every so often, trying to remain optimistic.  After our last meal, will be a while before we return.  Service was quite slow, as took quite a while to get the drinks out, and we had to find the server to get refills.  The pizza had very little taste.  Not sure if the crust was overcooked, or just little taste.  Pizza also took forever to come out.  Considering the premium price of their pizzas, I just can't see returning unless we start hearing some positives.

nKl-mkVWqEA75IsxVhABGg.text: Jasmyn is an angel. I came here for my birthday with my girlfriends and the food was good but the service was better. (The food was definitely 100% amazing). Jasmyn had so much knowledge about the menu and I loved it! I couldn't decide what to order and she helped me out. She's also the sweetest girl ever. She was SO fun. What topped it off for me is she chose my "birthday desert" based off of getting to know my likes ordering. She brought out this delicious butter cake with ice cream and it was to die for. She made me feel special, on my special day. I will definitely be coming back and will 100% hope I get her section again.

g0PL4UPwNzjvaN0HIenzCQ.text: Great service from our server Jason! Very friendly and family orientated man! He engaged with not only us but our children!

vFysmMY6pMPzQpjXnuK1Sw.text: I've been coming to this CPK ever since it first opened, which was when Town Square first opened. Granted, I don't go THAT often but on and off -- usually with friends or family. I typically prefer this location over the one at Fashion Show Mall only because I hate venturing towards the direction of the strip. Not only that but this location is bigger.   However, I don't have a single memory of exceptional service from this establishment. Not once in the amount of odd years it's been around. In fact, I remember one time, when I went with friends, no one came to our table for a LONG while (not even for drink orders) so what did we do? Build a fort out of the menus. I know, we were so immature but funny thing was, that didn't get their attention.   I just recently came back to dine at this establishment with my family after being away from Las Vegas for three years, and I gotta say... the service certainly hasn't improved. I gotta admit, it's not as busy as it used to be, but it still took a LONG while for any server to acknowledge our existence after we got seated. There was nothing wrong with the hostess, but there was something wrong with the waitresses. I think it took so long that ANOTHER waitress that wasn't OUR waitress came to take our orders because no one else helped us. Which caused a little confusion later on when the food arrived.   Other than that, everything else went fine. After we got our food, we were happy campers.   Speaking of the food, it is pretty on point. It's pretty good. One of my favorite is their bolognese pasta. Sometimes I like to ask for them to make it spicy, in which they add pepper flakes to the pasta. Always turns out yummy. The garlic cream fettuccine is also another favorite of mine but sometimes, the flavor can be so-so. Oh, their tiramisu never disappoints either :)   Not a bad place. Not a fabulous place. Still great to eat at with family and friends when you want some CPK. Gotta have patience though.

cgHcGPUnnDOBxsAvbviGeg.text: Good Pizza for a good price. Just what you're looking for in a restaurant right? I've had better pizza, but it also cost a lot more. I think California Pizza Kitchen has the right balance of quality for price. The dough is just right, and the toppings complement it just right. The atmosphere is a bit higher class, but relaxed as you'd expect from the location, so you're only going to see sharper dressed people there, without everyone being stuck up.

GGnF-6ig422H9AJPOE3tYQ.text: I haven't written a Yelp review before, but unfortunately, my last two visits to this CPK have been so bad that I felt the need to post this review.  The first time we went (1/21/17), we had an okay experience. The food was good overall, though there were a few things that were off: the bread was stale, our food came with toppings we specifically requested removed, and the raspberry iced tea was mostly too-sweet raspberry flavoring with a pinch of tea. The service was also a bit slow, but we enjoyed our time there. So, using a gift card I had been given, I tipped just under 10% -- leaving the balance exactly $11.  Today (4/2/17) we went again, and it was a great expereience. The food, drinks and service were fantastic, and we were very happy during our time there. The problem came when we went to pay the bill. I still had my original receipt from my old gift card, which showed it should have had $11 left. However, when we went to pay, it the balance was only $8. I was shocked, and then, disturbed to realize that the server from our first experience--who turned out to be our same server today, Chad--had clearly tipped himself an extra $3 when he ran our card back in January.  I didn't want to cause a scene and call him out--we had a fine time there today, after all--but that kind of behavior is inexcuseable. Since our server took the liberty of tipping himself extra last time, we left without leaving a tip. We love CPK-- but hate that our date was turned sour by staff's shady behavior. Safe to say, we sadly won't be returning to this location again.

_9yoUPLzRH5F9Ih1V-pUJA.text: I had a gift card and decided to place an order for pick-up. This CPK is located in Town Square. There is a pick-up door, but if there is parking near it I couldn't find it. Crowded is the proper word for Town Square! With no parking spot in sight and tons of people wandering around, hubby dropped me off out front. I was greeted when I walked in and the food was ready. The pizza came in a to-go carrier with handles that was very convenient. I ordered the "Untraditional Cheese Pizza" priced at $9.75 that was cheesy and good. Most pizzas with more than one cheese have a smokey type of cheese on it and this one didn't, which I loved. Simple and good!   You can place your pick-up order over the phone or online. The online ordering is very user friendly.

0Rf56XPaxj7xVQq55dxzrg.text: I know this is a common restaurant to go to around the US and I've been to a handful. Something about this particular location just seemed "meh"? Not a lot of flavor in their dishes and their service was slow. I'll try a different location instead of this one.

zs4iall3Fek-ZZZ_5VTMew.text: While I have eaten at this location and it is fine (yes, kind of loud and lots of kids), my review is for CPK in general.  I agree it is a little pricey for what you get, so we only go very infrequently.    One of my biggest peeves is restaurants that do not have a cravable dish.  Well, I love, love, love the waldorf chicken salad and the chicken tostada pizza (with the original crust, they changed it to flat bread, do not order it this way).   As for cpk in general, they can very few and far between have the chain syndrome of off food or staffing, their soda (also like many chains places is horrible) and their "free" bread, that oddly is only served sometimes, is also dry and tasteless, so I am glad that more than not it is not presented because i love bread and don't want to bother eating it.    We have rarely gotten other menu items, when with larger groups we order other random ones and enjoy them....the blt, the buffalo chicken (I think this is gone too) come to mind.  They took my husbands favorite of the sweet sausage and onion off the menu.  That also seems to be a problem for chains....when something works don't change it.....put the tostada pizza back on the original crust or people might not know how good it is.

S4QSimlN9srzmidnBNSx-g.text: Came in yesterday for an early dinner. -XwtIO9vSYnr6B6NDutOnw.text: Had a wonderful family dinner and dessert here. *Kevin* the waiter was the friendliest, most accommodating waiter I've ever encountered! Thumbs up.

TdrURI940OQboJ4sGpFsrw.text: I visited the newly remodeled Town Square location on Saturday (11/21) around 11:45am. We asked to sit outside because it was a nice cool afternoon. They sat us and from that point on it was as if we didn't exist. I order what I've been ordering for the last 15 years, the full size BBQ chicken salad. Since I always order that, I know what the portion is supposed to look like. The price has increased and the salad has shrunk. The full size is now comparable to what the half size used to be. I was very disappointed. How do you justify higher price for less food? When they dropped off my salad I asked the guy for a side of ranch. He said "sure" and that was the last I saw of him. I sat there for 15 minutes waiting for someone to come check on me outside so I can ask again. Finally, I had to leave my table and go inside the restaurant to ask a random cashier to get me a side of ranch. By this time, my salad was old, undersized, and just tasted wrong. Perhaps the whole experience is what put a bad taste in my mouth, but I couldn't eat more than one bite. Flagging down a waitress to address my issue was the ongoing challenge of the day (it wasn't busy). My friend that was dining with me literally stood up and waived her arms in the air from side to side to get someone's attention. That didn't work either. She was frustrated for me, and this was holding us up because she was already done eating. She went inside the restaurant and grabbed what seemed to be the manager. I didn't go into all of my issues because I didn't have the patience. I told them the salad that I always get didn't taste right and I just want them to prepare me the Garlic Cream Fettuccine and pack it TO GO since this has been a long drawn out ordeal. I felt like the manager was trying to upsell when he tried to push the grilled chicken option on me. I said "my chicken experience hasn't been good today so I'll pass". He pushed it on me more and I agreed to it just to get it done. I was told the salad would be taken off my bill. I thought to myself "that's a given, the salad wasn't made well, basically untouched and I'm sending it back"... When I got the bill, they offered no discount for my inconvenience, no free dessert, nothing. I'm just very put off by this experience. I hate that I'm going to have to stop coming to a place that I so often visit.

XdPOO1qRE3q5MI0V7HcC0A.text: We went here to celebrate a friends birthday, and had a wonderful time! Our server was very helpful and attentive. I had a strawberry basil margarita which was a little to sweet but refreshing. Now birthday girl had the spicy margarita...I want to say it was made with habaneros...word to the wise don't get this unless you reeeaaallyy like spicy. The sampler plate of spring rolls was tasty especially the southwestern roll. Our pizzas were good my favorite had pear, caramelized walnuts and gorgonzola! Overall great time, super friendly staff and for 4 drinks, 2 appetizers and 5 pizzas it was just a touch over $100.

irJCSKusl1TkavtxdnM1EQ.text: Something was wrong.  California Pizza Kitchen is my FAVORITE restaurant.    We've been here a million times, and the service and food quality was always CONSISTENTLY EXCEPTIONAL.    Not this time.    We walked in, sat down and were so thrilled and happy because my fiance and I had just gotten engaged.  Don't get me wrong- I don't put a price tag on food, so we could have chosen to eat anywhere fancy shmancy to celebrate our recent engagement. But what did lil' ol' me want to do??  I wanted a damn pizza from CPK!  Why? Because it was a refeed day from weeks of lifting and underfeeding (fitness/training talk) and like I said- it's my favorite restaurant, and I am ALWAYS happy when I go to and leave any CPK.  Our waiter walked over with a quietly foul, non-chalant, I don't give a sh*t attitude.  Totally killed our mood, but hey- I was okay with it because I just wanted my pizza.  Thai Pizza to be exact.  Edgar ordered fried mac & cheese, and I ordered hummus.  Pita was dry and lacked texture.  Mac & Cheese was dry.  Bleh.  My pizza was abysmal.  I've ordered this pizza dozens of times, and I was so disappointed.  But oh well, it is what it is. It was dry and lacked that peanuty flavor that it normally has.  It was just...just.  That's it.  Nothing more to it.  And Edgar's Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza was thin.  We didn't order thin.   I would give this visit a darn 1, but I'll leave it at 3 because I really do love the restaurant chain.  And if you know me-- I don't take to chains too much.    We'll definitely be back because I know it was an anamoly.

AgCeuLVnTE-L6o0C71awrQ.text: Food was good for the price paid. I however will not be returning to a CPK after my last three experiences. A few friends and myself were seated next to the server station where the input orders on the receipts.. Little did I realize it was gossip central of the customers they were serving. I found out that Greg doesn't tip well enough, Sandy smelt like a wet rag, and last but not least a manager was having an affair... All things I did not need to know. Unfortunately this was not my first run in and will not be returning.

KtyUZF1DtoR6bVNjNgpuhw.text: Wow this place is good. They really ought to think about expanding California Pizza Kitchen. Their name is a little long though... Ought to use an acronym like CPK.   Don't tell anybody about this little secret of a pizza place. I wouldn't want it to get all commercial and open up locations all over and start selling frozen pizza's at grocery stores.. imagine that..  All kidding aside... In comparison to other CPK's I found the food to be very good and fresh. It's most def in the top tier of CPK's when it comes to quality and service. Our waiter was great, the place was busy, and the food was really good..  Come on.. you know you've been to a less than stellar CPK... This is not one of those.. Very good.

_pqr6LKp3_rjhvvfcWlhNQ.text: I've been eating @ CPK for years.  Great spot for a group, lunch, get togethers  etc.  Just recently had the BUTTER CAKE - Its warm and so daymn good with the ice cream on top!  They offer small plates of dishes, which is a great idea.  They've been coming up with new entrees, desserts, coupon promotions.  I'm very happy CPK is still around.  I love their food.  This location at Town Square gets really busy, so expect a wait.  Lots of families and kiddies.

cY_Tn1imO1Z2clZxyXYPCA.text: I try to have lunch at CPK when I'm in town for business since I can walk around the shops and I'm close to the airport. The salads are always good. The staff is friendly and I love sitting outside!

Yc8rewbBE7uxMG12Na7Y3Q.text: The food was great,  but our server was amazing! Anthony was on the ball.  Our drinks were never empty, our food was fresh and great,  and he was in a great mood. Our server Anthony is the reason we want to go back.  The food was great and something different for us and we want to check out some of the other food they have.  If our server wasn't as great as he was might not have wanted to.

qQQfTPbWVk5j7B3HOUwMZQ.text: Tried to use no stars but wouldn't let me. 4 min wait after we were seated and the place is only 1/2 full. The worst part: they stopped selling Mountain Dew! Never coming back, bad service, high price, and no Mountain Dew. The pizza is not much better than the frozen and it's way quicker to run to the store and cook it than waiting in the restaurant! Used to love this place:(

IQq8oE-lRn6b88FiKc-dKQ.text: The location is the best thing about this place.  I know it is a chain but I expected much more.  The customer service from the hostess was good very pleasant and smiled the whole time.  the customer service from the waitress on the other hand was not up to par.  she seemed to be having a bad day.  My drink order was wrong that's an easy fix but then my meal was wrong too.  I ordered the Hawaiian pizza and got the thai chicken pizza instead.  I brought it to her attention but ate it anyway cause at this point I just wanted to get the hell out of there.  Now the pizza itself was good the peanut sauce was very tasty.  I think I would give this place one more chance and update my review.

We were seated directly in front of the door initially as I was distracted by "checking in", however when I noticed I asked to be moved catercorner to another both.  The greeter had no issue moving us and our server swapped stations to stay with us (A for effort).  Our server was patient while we decided and offered suggestions.  I took her advise and tried the Roasted Veggie Salad which I found that I actually like artichokes - who knew!  My youngest ordered the Garlic Fettuccine w/ Shrimp, but returned it after trying to give it life (flavor) by adding more cheese.  The manager came over to coax her into trying another dish, but it was too late.  The rest of us enjoyed our choices; The Works Pizza and a Waldorf Salad both yummy! kcWbEWLtuxiMhvw5_CHfdg.text: I haven't been here In about 2 + years, this place has changed a lot since the last time I was here. We split the spinach and artichoke dip and that was good. The chips were nice and salted and the artichoke dip was nice and hot. Then I ordered the California veggie pizza and added avocado and pineapple to it. The avocado didn't come out with it, but the server brought it out on the side. It still looked amazing, however it lacked so much flavor. It tasted as though the veggies were frozen, thawed, and then baked on pizza left with no nutrient or flavor. Not even the red pepper flakes helped my case. But this whole entire meal was made up by our desert, the salted Carmel pudding was amazing, that made the whole entire trip here worth it.

rX1NiAF15Nhop9na7_S5iQ.text: Wow. This server was AMAZINGGGGGGGGGG. Boyfriend and I decided to give CPK a 2nd chance because we were in the area. This has got to be the BEST experience at cpk...ever. Everything just went great with eachother. The sage on the bianco brought great flavors, the citric taste from the tequila fettuccini together with the rib eye, mannnn. Man 5/5 !  :) would come again only on days when this server is working LOL

0EudUFs1ZNSCg3tx2FM_Yg.text: This cpk is way better then the ones in in orange county California. Oh my my my the Jamaican jerk chicken. Pizza is delicious something i never experienced in my life. Great service. Also.  Will be coming back

JnQ1SYlxb3C9roAC3QfTJg.text: My husband and I went on a Saturday night so it was relatively busy. We were sat in 10 minutes and our server was at our table with barely any wait time. The servers and hosts were polite. The food was good but still over-priced relative to the portion and taste. The reason CPK will earn my return patronage is because the the manager, Jamie.  I tried to use a $25 gift card I received about seven months prior to my visit. The card was declined and showed a zero balance. We paid the remaining balance in cash which was not a problem. An hour later I contacted my aunt who had gifted me the card. She requested I retrieve the card so she can dispute the balance. When I returned the get the card it had already been thrown away. Jamie was extremely apologetic and she immediately gave me a $30 credit for my next visit. I am extremely impressed with the way the situation was handled. Jamie sympathized with me and accommodated the situation professionally. We will be returning.

voan0JhGmtbMsluNJHQn3Q.text: CPK is amazing! Hubby and I came here for dinner on our date nite/xmas shopping & they didn't fail!  Avocado Roll & Dumplings are a MUST!! And dinner entree was even better. Butter Cake for dessert topped off the nite! Will def b back  Thanks CPK!!

ikszFV1ZPMVMCuA1gifrLA.text: Have been to different CPKs all around town, food is delicious as always. But the service here was terrible!!   First of, there was a wait which was fine, however I saw two people came in after most of us but were seated before us, they were seated right away. I heard the host asked them "Did you want to eat here?" then seated them right away. I don't know what is the whole story with that but even another party looked around like "Why are they getting a table right away?!"   After we were seated the server came up to us immediately and asked for our orders. Everything was find with drink orders and food orders. He told us about the new items and was friendly enough. Our apps came pretty quickly which was nice, when the main courses came, I picked up our empty appetizers plates with the intention of giving the dishes to the food runner because we had no space left on our table, she put the food down on the table and walked away in a rush when I know for a fact that she saw me holding the dirty plates! The plates were huge and the runner was standing right next to me, there was no way that she did not see I was holding the plates, but she just walked away without the picking up the dirty plates. So we stacked the dirty plates to one side ate with very little space, the server eventually came to take the plates away, did not ask us if we needed anything else or how the food was. He did not check in with us at all until it was time for the check.   I have been to this particular CPK a few times before and service was find, but this time it was strange. Maybe they got new employees and needed more training.

-ebFB3KNL2drgGssxYeFxg.text: Guy at the front was nice. Waitress took forever to refill drinks while she carried on lengthy conversations with a specific table. There were at least 6 dirty tables that stayed dirty from before I got here until after I left. No they were nowhere near busy. I Just feel like customer service could be improved. Pizza was great tho.

3CukxzFkQHOsemW7O5gO6Q.text: Food was decent & our waiter was lots of fun. Took a bit longer than I felt it should have for two pizzas, salads, a cup of soup & one full entree. It had been a while since eating there & I remembered food being a lot tastier but it hit the spot. There were 6 of us & only one box to take leftovers. I still recommend checking it out but be prepared for a little of a wait on weekends. We had reservations so got right in.

_KgTvljN6M5p0ysoDuWQHQ.text: I don't come here often, but when I do it's always because I'm craving Thai crunch salad.   Ordered: 1 (half) Thai Crunch Salad, 1 fettuccine penne pasta (with shrimp) -- MORE than enough for two to share.  We were too full to even order any dessert, but we recommend the BUTTER CAKE any day.   Only reason I give a 4 star today is because during my visit today, the I ordered the Thai crunch without chicken, and the plate came back with chicken. I appreciate the manager taking his time to apologize to us, but that doesn't do anything about the additional wait time we had to endure.   ...but I'll still be back! :)

K3qEe14mDWbjt34UglaxPQ.text: My husband and I had a very pleasant experience here last week. We had been walking around Town Square for awhile and became a little tired and hungry. Pizza sounded good to us, so we ended up here at CPK.   Our hostess was good about getting our drinks started right away. She answered all of our questions in a prompt and friendly manner. She was also really attentive about refilling our drinks.  We ordered a pizza, half California Club, and half the Works. Please keep in mind that these pizzas are medium-sized, so you get 6 slices total. My husband had the Works: a take on supreme pizza. He liked it, but wasn't wowed by it. I had the California Club and I cannot express in words how good it was! It comes with bacon, cheese, romaine tossed in lemon pepper mayonnaise, and it is topped with avocado. The avocado and romaine were super fresh and the lemon pepper mayonnaise was the bomb! I liked it so much that as soon as I got home from the restaurant, I searched for a recipe for it with no avail, unfortunately. Hahaha.   Great service and good food. I'll be back if I find myself in the area again.

gmzCMVO7HUWtSB5NSauM8Q.text: There was this one very rude worker her name was Jessica . She should not be working there . Attitude the whole time , took forever to get us our drinks when the restaurant wasn't even half full .

3Gdpm8PPUpWFL5GVFeht0Q.text: This was the second time I've been to this location and I was very content with my trip. The wait for my friend and I was less than 5 minutes (on a Friday night at 7PM PST). We both started out with drinks and the chicken lettuce wrap appetizers. When I tell y'all I ALWAYS get this appetizer, I'm not kidding. It's something light, tangy, crunchy and something I look forward to ordering when I come here. For dinner, my friend and I both shared the Wild Mushroom Pizza. If you are a mushroom lover, this pizza is def for you. Thin crust, wonderful cheese ratio and the meatiness from the different mushrooms really make this pizza. We decided to get dessert and ordered the chocolate cake (sorry I can't remember the full name!!) with ice cream. It's really chocolaty, so if you don't mind that, this dessert is perfect for you

Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Lettuce Wraps!! There&#39;s a shrimp option, shrimp/chicken option, however I find the chicken provides the best flavor profile.

dCN0Gna7OWMzzgAUKakWvw.text: I have been to CPK with my family and friends many times, and they NEVER fail to disappoint. The wait time ranges from 5-25 minutes, and the staff is very attentive and comforting. They handle our food and drinks with care, and they also entertain us. Whether it's with small talk or jokes, they know how to do their job right. They even hold the door open for you when exiting! One of the things I really love about CPK are their happy hours. You can get yourself a rich cup of wine or a strong beer to sip on with your food. The food is beyond words! Each bite is a flavorful explosion in your mouth. I recommend the Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower as a small plate, the Avocado Club Egg Rolls or Spinach Artichoke Dip for an appetizer, and some type of savory pasta or hearty salad for an entree. The Chicken Piccata is absolutely mouthwatering, but the Roasted Veggie Salad is brilliant. You can even get shrimp, a slice of chicken, or a fillet of salmon for a little extra money on your salad! Lastly is the dessert. If you have the chance to order some dessert at CPK, then I highly advise you to. The Butter Cake and Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake are life-changing! You will not regret getting them. Also, their sundaes are simple but bring back some childhood memories. You may want to step out of your comfort zone and get a festive dessert for the season. If so, get the Pumpkin Cheesecake. It's creamy and just right!

y6706FOMyqMHTEK_fL2ShQ.text: My worst CPK experience.  We ordered king pao spaghetti, shrimp scampi zucchini fettuccine, egg rolls, and a half buffalo chicken salad.  I am deeply saddened by the protein food portioning.  The flavor is good, but I am convinced that I will no longer be dining at major chains as this was one of the last chains that I loved.  I will add a sad picture of Kung pao spaghetti...unreal experience.  Farewell my long time friend RIP CPK

4py39gyaMIc0B9YImEf49Q.text: Visited California Pizza Kitchen for the first time since I've lived in Vegas. I Loved going here with my daughter, family, and friends when I lived on the East Coast. I took a friend, he really enjoyed his  being that he's Vegan. It's kinda hard to find good places that are good to eat and the ambiance is inviting. BgQTsJh2UTw0Fr773_AY9Q.text: Love coming her for lunch. I always sit at the bar for quick service. D is usually the guy that helps my boyfriend and I, and my oh my. He is the best! He has a charismatic attitude and shows that he loves his job. He remembers our name and is super accommodating.   I love the lunch special with soup and pizza. I usually eat the veggie pizza and potato soup or something ha. I also order a Blueberry Ginger Smash. It's delicious. Sweet. Tangy and just the right amount of alcohol.

ugbzpfbPHldEw2S7iodi2A.text: I think the last time I went to a California Pizza Kitchen was at least 4 years ago in Michigan! Surprisingly I haven't gone to the one in Town Square, however, that changed today. One of my girlfriends wanted to catch up with a light lunch and recommended we go here.  We shared the Tortilla Spring Rolls as an app - you can choose from 3 different kinds and we got the Mediterranean Veggie and the Thai Chicken (Baja Chicken is the third choice). Three small portions of each came out with a marinara sauce for the veggie and a sweet peanut sauce for the thai spring rolls. They were both pretty tasty and a great way to start our lunch.   I wanted a salad and went with the half portion of the Waldorf Chicken Salad and my friend got the half portion of the Moroccan Chicken Salad. The half portions are humongous and look like a full portion to me. Perfect size for lunch. My salad was incredibly delicious! Mixed greens with grapes, green apples, celery, chicken, candied walnuts, crumbled Gorgonzola, pre-tossed in a light vinaigrette. I wouldn't recommend getting this salad if you don't like Gorgonzola because as you know, it has a strong distinct taste and can be overpowering in any dish. I didn't mind at all because I LOVE cheese and Gorgonzola.   Katie was our server and she was fantastic! Very friendly and checked up on us quite often to make sure we were enjoying everything and to refill our drinks.  I'm very satisfied with my lunch today and would gladly go back! Highly recommend California Pizza Kitchen if you're in Town Square and craving a fresh salad. I'll have to try their pizza next time.

3YMSx0CsBSG0yyl2M-GlmQ.text: I have been coming here since it opened here in town square ,well I always get the same thing the chicken piccata ..only this time I thought it was tough till I realized it was raw !!the bartender Monica was wonderful ,however the poor excuse for manager needs to understand the magnitude of this instead she took it off the bill as she should of but I feel like I just ate raw chicken  seriously !!

_mRB9tsTfYmLz-mJ2KPvHA.text: We've been here a few times. Now is one of my favorite restaurant. Service excellent and staff super friendly. We ordered the BBQ pizza and pastas. Everything was great!! Thank u CPK!!!

pBnoTVWLk1CwXILaKK-eTw.text: WOW, this was by far the BEST experience we have ever had at a CPK.   We usually have fairly good experiences at CPKs. The food is always good, the service is decent, we never really have too much to complain about but my gosh, this location really knows what they're doing.   As soon as we walked in, Jesse politely greeted us & thanked us for coming in to dine with them. I literally felt like I just showed up to his house for dinner, he was so nice. Turns out, he was the GM so that explained his great service. He probably services as an elite example for his staff. We were asked our seating preference and we chose a booth in the bar area.   Our server DeMond really made our experience even better. He was personable and prompt. When we ordered, we went with his suggestion. The Pesto Cream Penne Pasta had great flavor and it was a generous portion of food. We also ordered the California Club pizza & a Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler. The California Club was a unique take on pizza. It came with Arugula tossed salad & fresh avocados on top. My fiance literally joked, "did you order a salad??". While the presentation was intimidating, the blend of ingredients was genius. We enjoyed everything but what made our experience exemplary was the service we received tonight.   Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of California Pizza Kitchen at Town Square Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Mango Strawberry Cooler

NRHTPLHuyCLI3e_m7nbnEQ.text: My mom, uncle and I had lunch here recently.  We were seated right away and our waitress come over and took drink orders.  She was very good, came by often and brought refills without asking.  I had the PEAR + GORGONZOLA pizza - Bosc pears, sweet caramelized onions and hazelnuts, topped with chilled field greens in housemade Gorgonzola ranch. Always my favorite.  Good as ever.   Mom had the PEPPERONI pizza - A combination of rustic and spicy pepperoni with fresh Mozzarella and wild Greek oregano. Always her favorite too.  My uncle had the KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI.  It looked tasty but spicy. Lots of hot peppers.    CPK is pretty similar no matter what location you go to.  This one was no exception.  Good food and service.

J8lPa8b5lq_fh5TVEOEA0Q.text: Last night my friends and I went to California Pizza kitchen and had dinner. I had such a great time. Selena was our server and she was so awesome.  She was sweet, it was close to closing and she didn't even care!  I love great customer service and when I get it I have to do a shout out!  Way to go CPK!

A5ddH2kYqtj1rY2EjdKxWw.text: First time for me at here. I really love BBQ Chicken pizza and cornflower (in pic). I went here in Mother day a little bit busy but wait not to long. Service is great but waiting food so long.

R8v0QEdtpGEeAOzXhwEPFQ.text: This pizza was probably the best pizza I've ate out here in Vegas so far! No too greasy. Not sloppy. But not dry neither. It was thin. But not to where it won't fill you up. It still fills you up. I really loved the pizza. It's very close to tasting like the good old pizza back from my home town Fresno in California. They also have one of those pizza places in L.A. and it's the last remaining one that's still it's classic old look. And the pizza taste better there than it did in Bakersfield. It's probably the only best pizza place there in L.A. all I've ever been to in L.A. was just sloppy thin pizza that's greasy. The pizzas place is called Me-N-Ed's pizzeria. And I'll 96% guarantee you'll love it. If you try it with their ranch that you'll have to pay for 50 for two I believe. It'll make you love the pizza even more and you will keep craving that pizza. But this is a review for California Kitchen Pizza. And it'll stay that way lol! The pizza from here was amazing in my opinion! Thinking of it is making hungry right now... I guess I'll stop by there again. And this is my very first time eating here too. Looking forward to going here every other week. Oh! And don't forget to put their parmesan on your pizza. IT'S TO DIE FOR!!
